This commit only fixes for nova datasource.

subject: initialize ceilometerclient when we use it
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-25 07:22:54.000000000', 'files': ['aodh/evaluator/threshold.py'], 'message': 'initialize ceilometerclient when we use it

There is a chance that ceilometerclient cannot be initialized if
keystone is not available, putting the initialization in __init__
will fail to load threshold extension for such case.

This patch moves the initialization out from __init__ to a dedicate
property method.

Change-Id: I24895126c3efe9920390401e4d10a2ce6b1f1376
Closes-Bug: #1518447
'}]
commit_message:
initialize ceilometerclient when we use it

There is a chance that ceilometerclient cannot be initialized if
keystone is not available, putting the initialization in __init__
will fail to load threshold extension for such case.

This patch moves the initialization out from __init__ to a dedicate
property method.

Change-Id: I24895126c3efe9920390401e4d10a2ce6b1f1376
Closes-Bug: #1518447

subject: Use sudo for role testing
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-11-25 22:46:27.000000000', 'files': ['tests/ansible.cfg', 'tests/inventory', 'tests/test.yml'], 'message': "Use sudo for role testing

There are 2 ways to realize the privilege escalation
needed for the gate jobs.

1) Editing the playbooks (and hope to not forget to
write the sudo/become lines for every role)
2) Editing the inventory and set the variable there.

I'm taking the second approach with the minimum set
of variables (become_method is sudo by default and
become_user is root by default).

Change-Id: Iac16f49b514f41684b319e3d091b52513f721b55
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Use sudo for role testing

There are 2 ways to realize the privilege escalation
needed for the gate jobs.

1) Editing the playbooks (and hope to not forget to
write the sudo/become lines for every role)
2) Editing the inventory and set the variable there.

I'm taking the second approach with the minimum set
of variables (become_method is sudo by default and
become_user is root by default).

Change-Id: Iac16f49b514f41684b319e3d091b52513f721b55
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Pin setuptools == 18.5

Yesterday the new versions of setuptools (18.6 and 18.6.1) were released
where some functionality such as installation in the editable mode was
broken. It will be fixed in the 18.6.2 release.

Change-Id: Id19879c788efbba6c6e72fe6a4a97418df124525
Partial-Bug: #1519727

commit_message:
Add synchronizer for policies and rules

This synchronizer keeps the policy engine's policies and rules in sync with
the database.  With this change, Congress should be able to run policy engine
replicas side-by-side in an high-availability configuration.

Implements blueprint: basic-high-availability
Change-Id: I72d8a9952d8345129656c4a701896614fa837a08

commit_message:
Modularize inventory and add initial testing

The inventory module for bifrost is a vital component, however
as it was developed as a single file and it needs to to be broken
up into a modular chunk in order to have meaningful testing.

Broke into module, symlinking the file into place for now until
documentation and install process can be updated.

Added two basic tests to lay the groundwork for basic testing
of the data parsing and result passing.

Change-Id: I02e79b635202a7933ae641b9d27cc19a75b7bc4f
Partial-Bug: 1499801

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-11-25 13:03:09.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/unit/common/test_images.py', 'ironic/drivers/modules/agent.py', 'etc/ironic/ironic.conf.sample', 'ironic/common/images.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/test_agent.py'], 'message': 'Add switch to enable/disable streaming raw images for IPA

This patch is adding a configuration option called "stream_raw_images"
under the "agent" group. By default this option is set to True, meaning
that the IPA ramdisk will be instructed to stream raw images directly
onto the disk instead of copying it to a tmpfs partition prior of
writing it to the disk. By streaming raw images IPA will consume less
memory to run and the deployment will be faster (unless the disk being
deployed is really slow).

Depends-On: Iddf67907bc9b54bbd3065a97064cb5a3602cfe18
Related-Bug: #1505685
Change-Id: I7e7ed7e7aeebbf7c936605a72aa974db2123a43e
'}]
commit_message:
Add switch to enable/disable streaming raw images for IPA

This patch is adding a configuration option called "stream_raw_images"
under the "agent" group. By default this option is set to True, meaning
that the IPA ramdisk will be instructed to stream raw images directly
onto the disk instead of copying it to a tmpfs partition prior of
writing it to the disk. By streaming raw images IPA will consume less
memory to run and the deployment will be faster (unless the disk being
deployed is really slow).

Depends-On: Iddf67907bc9b54bbd3065a97064cb5a3602cfe18
Related-Bug: #1505685
Change-Id: I7e7ed7e7aeebbf7c936605a72aa974db2123a43e

Bug  :  Not able to create a resource without sync attribute

without sync attribute,function gives error.

GPFS driver was using 'volume_metadata' to get the

commit_message:
Fix metadata retrieval in GPFS driver

GPFS driver was using 'volume_metadata' to get the
volume metadata. With versionedobjects, it is to be
retrieved using 'metadata' from volume.
This patch fixes the issue. It first tries for 'volume_metadata'
in the volume object, if not present, it will try for 'metadata'
to get the metadata.

Change-Id: I97649874ab54187a469193c8cae773409e9913e6
Closes-bug: 1517404

subject: Remove dependency on instance_info for DHCP config
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5805, 'name': 'Chris Krelle', 'email': 'nobodycam@gmail.com', 'username': 'nobodycam'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'Flying to the moon with a Jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 12459, 'name': 'Stephanie Miller', 'email': 'stephane@alum.mit.edu', 'username': 'cinerama'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-13 19:29:45.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/bifrost-deploy-nodes-dynamic/tasks/main.yml'], 'message': 'Remove dependency on instance_info for DHCP config

According to the documentation[1], instance_info variable is used to
define the instance that will be deployed, and has nothing to do with
its networking configuration. It therefore is not sensible to only
allow static DHCP settings for nodes with instance_info defined since
"By default, this is NOT expected to be defined".

Moreover, when the new dhcp-hosts file is created in
bifrost.dhcp-hosts.d/, dnsmasq needs to re-read this directory
regardless of whether instance_info is defined, so it does not make
sense for the "Sending dnsmasq HUP" task to be dependent on
instance_info NOT being defined.

Sending HUP should be safe to do; according to the dnsmasq man page,

  When it receives a SIGHUP, dnsmasq clears its cache and then
  re-loads /etc/hosts and /etc/ethers and any file given by
  --dhcp-hostsfile, --dhcp-hostsdir, --dhcp-optsfile, --dhcp-optsdir,
  --addn-hosts or --hostsdir. The dhcp lease change script is called
  for all existing DHCP leases. If --no-poll is set SIGHUP also
  re-reads /etc/resolv.conf. SIGHUP does NOT re-read the configuration
  file."

This does not imply any disruption of service. This assumption is
consistent with a reading of the dnsmasq signal handling code[2].

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/bifrost/tree/playbooks/roles/bifrost-deploy-nodes-dynamic/README.md#n45
[2] http://bazaar.launchpad.net/~vcs-imports/dnsmasq/master/view/head:/src/dnsmasq.c#L1193

Change-Id: Iae0dae8ad4dd7c9f2263b97875702ed0970761cf
'}]
commit_message:
Remove dependency on instance_info for DHCP config

According to the documentation[1], instance_info variable is used to
define the instance that will be deployed, and has nothing to do with
its networking configuration. It therefore is not sensible to only
allow static DHCP settings for nodes with instance_info defined since
"By default, this is NOT expected to be defined".

Moreover, when the new dhcp-hosts file is created in
bifrost.dhcp-hosts.d/, dnsmasq needs to re-read this directory
regardless of whether instance_info is defined, so it does not make
sense for the "Sending dnsmasq HUP" task to be dependent on
instance_info NOT being defined.

Sending HUP should be safe to do; according to the dnsmasq man page,

  When it receives a SIGHUP, dnsmasq clears its cache and then
  re-loads /etc/hosts and /etc/ethers and any file given by
  --dhcp-hostsfile, --dhcp-hostsdir, --dhcp-optsfile, --dhcp-optsdir,
  --addn-hosts or --hostsdir. The dhcp lease change script is called
  for all existing DHCP leases. If --no-poll is set SIGHUP also
  re-reads /etc/resolv.conf. SIGHUP does NOT re-read the configuration
  file."

This does not imply any disruption of service. This assumption is
consistent with a reading of the dnsmasq signal handling code[2].

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/bifrost/tree/playbooks/roles/bifrost-deploy-nodes-dynamic/README.md#n45
[2] http://bazaar.launchpad.net/~vcs-imports/dnsmasq/master/view/head:/src/dnsmasq.c#L1193

Change-Id: Iae0dae8ad4dd7c9f2263b97875702ed0970761cf

subject: Make delete_server() return True/False
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-11-25 19:35:11.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/unit/test_delete_server.py', 'shade/tests/functional/test_compute.py', 'shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'message': 'Make delete_server() return True/False

To be consistent with our other delete API methods, make delete_server()
return True if the delete succeeded, or False if the server was not
deleted because it was not found.

This also combines the functional testing of create_server() and
delete_server() so that tests are more efficient by eliminating an
extra instance creation. This is in anticipation of adding more
tests that will create server instances and there are only so
many resources available in the test environment.

Change-Id: If1b1a3886df60fb064682caa23113f91b78a4090
'}]
commit_message:
Make delete_server() return True/False

To be consistent with our other delete API methods, make delete_server()
return True if the delete succeeded, or False if the server was not
deleted because it was not found.

This also combines the functional testing of create_server() and
delete_server() so that tests are more efficient by eliminating an
extra instance creation. This is in anticipation of adding more
tests that will create server instances and there are only so
many resources available in the test environment.

Change-Id: If1b1a3886df60fb064682caa23113f91b78a4090

commit_message:
VMware: Skip unsupported datastore types

vCenter supports different types of datastores such as
VMFS, NFS etc. Currently the VMDK driver supports only
vSAN, VMFS and NFS datastores for storing volume vmdks.
This patch adds a check to skip unsupported datastore
types during volume creation.

Closes-bug: #1519316
Change-Id: I314abbe0de09bb304859c72b27054784eeef9044

The 'separate' CPU threads policy requires a host with an SMT
architecture but ensures vCPUs are allocated from non-thread siblings.
This is useful for workloads that may see performance impacts due to

Implements: blueprint virt-driver-cpu-thread-pinning

commit_message:
Add 'hw:cpu_threads_policy=separate' scheduling

The 'separate' CPU threads policy requires a host with an SMT
architecture but ensures vCPUs are allocated from non-thread siblings.
This is useful for workloads that may see performance impacts due to
contention.

Change-Id: I18b3a6413450d5f0cbc3eb8e66a2bcda23293478
Implements: blueprint virt-driver-cpu-thread-pinning

subject: Use sudo for role testing
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-11-25 20:39:22.000000000', 'files': ['tests/ansible.cfg', 'tests/inventory', 'tests/test.yml'], 'message': "Use sudo for role testing

There are 2 ways to realize the privilege escalation
needed for the gate jobs.

1) Editing the playbooks (and hope to not forget to
write the sudo/become lines for every role)
2) Editing the inventory and set the variable there.

I'm taking the second approach with the minimum set
of variables (become_method is sudo by default and
become_user is root by default).

Change-Id: I066ac778f7bf3d3f569791e30067bcab4e8eef6b
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Use sudo for role testing

There are 2 ways to realize the privilege escalation
needed for the gate jobs.

1) Editing the playbooks (and hope to not forget to
write the sudo/become lines for every role)
2) Editing the inventory and set the variable there.

I'm taking the second approach with the minimum set
of variables (become_method is sudo by default and
become_user is root by default).

Change-Id: I066ac778f7bf3d3f569791e30067bcab4e8eef6b
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-19 08:46:13.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/neutronv2/api.py', 'nova/network/model.py'], 'message': 'SR-IOV: Improve the vnic type check in the neutron api

The Neutronv2 API checks the vnic_type to see whether
or not it should include a PCI requests for SR-IOV ports.
The check is "if the vnic_type is not NORMAL" which is fine
for now that we have only NORMAL, DIRECT and MACVTAP, but in the future more vnic types
can be added. This patch update the check to be what the vnic types
are expecting to be.

Change-Id: I7b8ba1acfbafc3d02ab50afadf4627fcce052484
'}]
commit_message:
SR-IOV: Improve the vnic type check in the neutron api

The Neutronv2 API checks the vnic_type to see whether
or not it should include a PCI requests for SR-IOV ports.
The check is "if the vnic_type is not NORMAL" which is fine
for now that we have only NORMAL, DIRECT and MACVTAP, but in the future more vnic types
can be added. This patch update the check to be what the vnic types
are expecting to be.

Change-Id: I7b8ba1acfbafc3d02ab50afadf4627fcce052484

sent during router creation. Only send it if it is different
from the default (i.e., only when False).

commit_message:
Adjust conditions when enable_snat is specified

Some clouds barf about policy if the enable_snat attribute is
sent during router creation. Only send it if it is different
from the default (i.e., only when False).

This is a fix for:
https://github.com/ansible/ansible-modules-core/issues/2474

Change-Id: Id656029b9cf593fcb8e0771fa19c567126c565ee

opaque value, obtained from self.driver._setup_via_manager with

commit_message:
glusterfs/volume layout: fix incorrect usage of export_location

Actually, all uses of export_location are incorrect -- from the
layout code's point of view, export_location is an arbitrary
opaque value, obtained from self.driver._setup_via_manager with
which the only legit action is to return it from create_share*.

That we use export_location as dict key in ensure_share is just
a pre-layout relict that survived by the virtue of remaining
unnoticed. Now the referred bug forced it out of the dark.

Change-Id: I965dae99486002f00145daff0cd2a848777b5b81
Partial-Bug: #1501670

commit_message:
Fix gate-nova-functional-constraints

Tox runs gerrit-git-prep, however when constraints are used
zuul-git-prep-upper-constraints must be used.  Make a new tox job
template that pulls in the required git-prep and update nova to use it.

Implements Blueprint: Requirements-Management

Change-Id: I59fcf763d7eb9252e950dce5783befc20b4e8fd4

An LVM volume can be attached to multi instances, however,
this feature is not declared in LVMVolume driver. As a result,
if a user create a multi-attached volume using LVMVolume as
backend, they will be failed.

In this commit, we declared multiattach is True in LVMVolume
driver.

Change-Id: I66a4d62054fee14da6cf029084074453b30eb1bc
'}]
commit_message:
Declare multiattach is True in LVMVolume driver

An LVM volume can be attached to multi instances, however,
this feature is not declared in LVMVolume driver. As a result,
if a user create a multi-attached volume using LVMVolume as
backend, they will be failed.

In this commit, we declared multiattach is True in LVMVolume
driver.

Change-Id: I66a4d62054fee14da6cf029084074453b30eb1bc

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-11-24 11:18:30.000000000', 'files': ['tests-py3.txt', 'cinder/volume/drivers/ibm/storwize_svc/__init__.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/ibm/storwize_svc/storwize_svc_common.py'], 'message': "Port IBM storewize_svc driver to Python 3

Change default preferred node in
StorwizeSVCDriver.initialize_connection(). For fiber channel without
multipath, pick the first node from the list of sorted nodes, to have
a determinist preferred node. The list of nodes is created indirectly
using list(set(nodes)) which doesn't have a determinist order. On
Python 3, the hash function is randomized, and so list(set()) has an
unknown order.

A similar change was done for volume throttling in the change
Icf7141f772397c7ac08f0f1e21ad74cb86a06351 to port the code
to Python 3.

Other changes:

* Use assertSetEqual() in test_storwize_svc to compare
  initiator_target_map, because conn_wwpns has a random order on
  Python 3.
* StorwizeSVCDriver._check_volume_copy_ops(): replace dict.items()
  with list(dict.items()) to iterate on items. On Python 3,
  dict.items() now returns a view instead of a copy. The loop
  modifies the dictionary and a dict must not be modified while
  iterating on it, we really need a copy of items.
* StorwizeHelpers: replace a/b with a//b to use integer division on
  Python 3.
* tests-py3.txt: add cinder.tests.unit.test_storwize_svc

Partial-Implements: blueprint cinder-python3
Change-Id: I534a85928816d6cce921545e1820311aedd1b884
"}]
commit_message:
Port IBM storewize_svc driver to Python 3

Change default preferred node in
StorwizeSVCDriver.initialize_connection(). For fiber channel without
multipath, pick the first node from the list of sorted nodes, to have
a determinist preferred node. The list of nodes is created indirectly
using list(set(nodes)) which doesn't have a determinist order. On
Python 3, the hash function is randomized, and so list(set()) has an
unknown order.

A similar change was done for volume throttling in the change
Icf7141f772397c7ac08f0f1e21ad74cb86a06351 to port the code
to Python 3.

Other changes:

* Use assertSetEqual() in test_storwize_svc to compare
  initiator_target_map, because conn_wwpns has a random order on
  Python 3.
* StorwizeSVCDriver._check_volume_copy_ops(): replace dict.items()
  with list(dict.items()) to iterate on items. On Python 3,
  dict.items() now returns a view instead of a copy. The loop
  modifies the dictionary and a dict must not be modified while
  iterating on it, we really need a copy of items.
* StorwizeHelpers: replace a/b with a//b to use integer division on
  Python 3.
* tests-py3.txt: add cinder.tests.unit.test_storwize_svc

Partial-Implements: blueprint cinder-python3
Change-Id: I534a85928816d6cce921545e1820311aedd1b884

commit_message:
Use oslo_config new type PortOpt for port options

The oslo_config library provides new type PortOpt to validate the
range of port now.

Note, rpc_zmq_max_port is a socket port upper limit, so leave it untouched.

Change-Id: Icac28141bcb09e2b894662de1a6497766351919d
Closes-Bug: #1518256
ref: https://github.com/openstack/oslo.config/blob/2.6.0/oslo_config/cfg.py#L1114

subject: Make zuul-git-prep-upper-constraints safe for post
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-25 19:22:16.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/macros.yaml'], 'message': 'Make zuul-git-prep-upper-constraints safe for post

Extend zuul-git-prep-upper-constraints to infer a target branch from
$ZUUL_REFNAME when $ZUUL_BRANCH is not present. This works around
the absence of branch guidance for ref-updated triggers in post
pipeline jobs, where Zuul is not told a branch but Gerrit instead
uses the branch as the refname for the event.

Change-Id: I3fd06cc1f09847f6731f80deb00fd1515f0106e9
'}]
commit_message:
Make zuul-git-prep-upper-constraints safe for post

Extend zuul-git-prep-upper-constraints to infer a target branch from
$ZUUL_REFNAME when $ZUUL_BRANCH is not present. This works around
the absence of branch guidance for ref-updated triggers in post
pipeline jobs, where Zuul is not told a branch but Gerrit instead
uses the branch as the refname for the event.

Change-Id: I3fd06cc1f09847f6731f80deb00fd1515f0106e9

commit_message:
Add 'hw:cpu_threads_policy=avoid' filtering

The 'avoid' CPU threads policy prevents guests from being scheduled
onto hosts utilising SMT technologies, such as Intel Hyper-Threading
Technology. SMT provides performance benefits, but comes at the cost
of reduced determinism. This makes it unsuitable for some workloads
were such determinism is critical, e.g. NFV.

Add support for this 'avoid' CPU threads policy filter. This is
achieved through the use of the NUMA topology filter.

Change-Id: I7fc87755e1035bd5dd31bfd334213e41829bea2d
Implements: blueprint virt-driver-cpu-thread-pinning

commit_message:
Remove AuxAddresses from the required properties

This patch removes AuxAddresses in IPv4Data and IPv6Data in the request
against /NetworkDriver.CreateNetwork. It can not be given if it's not
specified by the CLI rather than it's set to an empty JSON object.

Change-Id: I5a36fa78adee09d91c19d533bfcf660109a0ec21
Signed-off-by: Taku Fukushima <f.tac.mac@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1519260

Calling Notifier.audit() won't work with LogDriver as the
logger does not have a audit level anymore, So let's at
least not fail silently and let the operators know that

Change-Id: I74002c72e6763ea8b5df7d97d722619bd4a1950b

commit_message:
Add Warning when we cannot notify

Calling Notifier.audit() won't work with LogDriver as the
logger does not have a audit level anymore, So let's at
least not fail silently and let the operators know that
we are dropping stuff on the floor.

Closes-Bug: #1518170
Change-Id: I74002c72e6763ea8b5df7d97d722619bd4a1950b

commit_message:
Default for root_helper config

This sets the default for root_helper config to the value used
by ironic: 'sudo ironic-rootwrap /etc/ironic/rootwrap.conf'.

The logic was changed a bit so as not to pass root_helper or
run_as_root arguments to processutils.execute() unless they
had been specified or needed to be passed.

Change-Id: I8cf8c07102d0a8bd4fff14afc8c2f9db6beeb949
Fixes-Bug: #1519870

commit_message:

subject: Fix resource leak in test_compute
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-11-25 12:34:49.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/functional/test_compute.py'], 'message': "Fix resource leak in test_compute

Depending on the time between the create_server() and
delete_server() calls, it's possible the delete does not
actually find the server we want to delete, so we leave
instances hanging around after our tests. Fix this by waiting
for the servers with wait=True to create_server().

Change-Id: I908fdb94dcf5e410597a7cd3ecc6c962f2bfbce3
"}]
commit_message:
Fix resource leak in test_compute

Depending on the time between the create_server() and
delete_server() calls, it's possible the delete does not
actually find the server we want to delete, so we leave
instances hanging around after our tests. Fix this by waiting
for the servers with wait=True to create_server().

Change-Id: I908fdb94dcf5e410597a7cd3ecc6c962f2bfbce3

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-24 09:20:44.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/rbd.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_rbd.py'], 'message': 'Declare multiattach is True in RBD driver

An RBD volume can be attached to multi instances, however,
this feature is not declared in RBD driver. As a result,
if a user create a multi-attached volume using RBD as
backend, they will be failed.

In this commit, we declared multiattach is True in RBD
driver.

Change-Id: I70c2c0528d9c00629f9cf34d79262a5bf4750e34
Closes-Bug: #1519227
'}]
commit_message:
Declare multiattach is True in RBD driver

An RBD volume can be attached to multi instances, however,
this feature is not declared in RBD driver. As a result,
if a user create a multi-attached volume using RBD as
backend, they will be failed.

In this commit, we declared multiattach is True in RBD
driver.

subject: Clean up compute functional tests
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-11-25 12:34:49.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/functional/test_compute.py'], 'message': "Clean up compute functional tests

Although the server names being created were actually unique
across tests, this change will make the test_compute.py code
more consistent with other functional test code by creating
a server name prefix string with getUniqueString(). This also
opens the door for use across new tests.

It also changes the server cleanup code to just call
delete_server() with the name of the instance for the test.
Since tests can run in parallel, we don't want to delete an

Change-Id: I1b0dc3f2759f77b7d420e45b3a7a2730868e6eb0

commit_message:
Clean up compute functional tests

Although the server names being created were actually unique
across tests, this change will make the test_compute.py code
more consistent with other functional test code by creating
a server name prefix string with getUniqueString(). This also
opens the door for use across new tests.

It also changes the server cleanup code to just call
delete_server() with the name of the instance for the test.
Since tests can run in parallel, we don't want to delete an
instance with a similar name out from under some other test.

Change-Id: I1b0dc3f2759f77b7d420e45b3a7a2730868e6eb0

commit_message:
Unexpected exception on tox test output on non-error

When the co-routine invoked by the event_simulator throws an exception
it was being spit out to the stdout. This exception on a non-error is
confusing. The proposed change will enable an exception handler in the
event_simulator (which was commented out) and catch the exception and
push it to the log file.

Change-Id: I7633ded724f30836b2c5bd471d305f57ab04ce4d
Closes-Bug: #1378083

commit_message:
Updates the update_user_attributes functionality

Reasons:
- While using update-user-attributes to change the user's name
  or host access the old access to the databases is left behind.
- The correct way to update user or host name is to use RENAME USER.

Changes:
- Updated statements to use "RENAME USER" for renaming the
  username or hostname.
- Updated statements to use "SET PASSWORD FOR" for changing passwords.
- Unit tests updated for sql_query.py
- Integration tests added to test the intended functionality for
  (user/host)-name updation.

Change-Id: Id87da96363d3cb932e6a92a611eebb054897a409
Closes-Bug: #1380880

subject: Update: clean keepalived and radvd instances after pcs cluster stop
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-24 13:12:00.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/yum_update.sh'], 'message': 'Update: clean keepalived and radvd instances after pcs cluster stop

Older neutron versions have a bug which makes them leave keepalived and
radvd running even after all neutron services are stopped, preventing
neutron router failover from happening. Router can then get stuck on the
inactive node, like this:

[stack@instack ~]$ neutron l3-agent-list-hosting-router default_router
+--------------------------------------+------------------------------------+----------------+-------+----------+
| id                                   | host                               | admin_state_up | alive | ha_state |
+--------------------------------------+------------------------------------+----------------+-------+----------+
| 48ca9477-b93b-4305-9e6d-9f1c5d3388f0 | overcloud-controller-1.localdomain | True           | :-)   | standby  |
| eba0575c-654f-4da6-b1cd-f7fdf1cd3726 | overcloud-controller-2.localdomain | True           | :-)   | standby  |
| 68815390-251f-4425-a5f8-38bdbf3bdb90 | overcloud-controller-0.localdomain | True           | xxx   | active   |
+--------------------------------------+------------------------------------+----------------+-------+----------+

We need to kill the leftover processes manually to prevent the state
described above from happening.

See https://review.gerrithub.io/#/c/248931

Change-Id: I2deaa176222983daa0c33ab52a6aa5dbe7365302
'}]
commit_message:
Update: clean keepalived and radvd instances after pcs cluster stop

Older neutron versions have a bug which makes them leave keepalived and
radvd running even after all neutron services are stopped, preventing
neutron router failover from happening. Router can then get stuck on the
inactive node, like this:

[stack@instack ~]$ neutron l3-agent-list-hosting-router default_router
+--------------------------------------+------------------------------------+----------------+-------+----------+
| id                                   | host                               | admin_state_up | alive | ha_state |
+--------------------------------------+------------------------------------+----------------+-------+----------+
| 48ca9477-b93b-4305-9e6d-9f1c5d3388f0 | overcloud-controller-1.localdomain | True           | :-)   | standby  |
| eba0575c-654f-4da6-b1cd-f7fdf1cd3726 | overcloud-controller-2.localdomain | True           | :-)   | standby  |
| 68815390-251f-4425-a5f8-38bdbf3bdb90 | overcloud-controller-0.localdomain | True           | xxx   | active   |
+--------------------------------------+------------------------------------+----------------+-------+----------+

We need to kill the leftover processes manually to prevent the state
described above from happening.

See https://review.gerrithub.io/#/c/248931

Change-Id: I2deaa176222983daa0c33ab52a6aa5dbe7365302

subject: Corrects INCLUDE_MARKER_OPERATORS for MySQL
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-09 07:23:18.000000000', 'files': ['trove/guestagent/datastore/mysql/service.py', 'trove/tests/unittests/guestagent/test_dbaas.py'], 'message': 'Corrects INCLUDE_MARKER_OPERATORS for MySQL

Reasons:
- Currently the value of INCLUDE_MARKER_OPERATORS[True] means ">=".
- Because of this when matching the database name it results in
  name >= value, which results in more than needed values and
  the sorting mechanism then may return the other value similar
  to one matched as explained in bug.

Changes:
- Corrects the value for INCLUDE_MARKER_OPERATORS[True] means ">="
  to INCLUDE_MARKER_OPERATORS[True] means "=",
  so that only matched value is returned.
- Updated the tests for matching the resulting query.

Change-Id: Ia197b007917f1b5f9f681e0d2d749489235052be
Closes-Bug: #1316717
'}]
commit_message:
Corrects INCLUDE_MARKER_OPERATORS for MySQL

Reasons:
- Currently the value of INCLUDE_MARKER_OPERATORS[True] means ">=".
- Because of this when matching the database name it results in
  name >= value, which results in more than needed values and
  the sorting mechanism then may return the other value similar
  to one matched as explained in bug.

Changes:
- Corrects the value for INCLUDE_MARKER_OPERATORS[True] means ">="
  to INCLUDE_MARKER_OPERATORS[True] means "=",
  so that only matched value is returned.
- Updated the tests for matching the resulting query.

Change-Id: Ia197b007917f1b5f9f681e0d2d749489235052be
Closes-Bug: #1316717

[{'number': 14, 'created': '2015-07-01 06:50:10.000000000', 'files': ['trove/tests/unittests/taskmanager/test_clusters.py', 'trove/tests/unittests/taskmanager/test_vertica_clusters.py', 'trove/common/strategies/cluster/experimental/vertica/taskmanager.py', 'trove/common/strategies/cluster/experimental/mongodb/taskmanager.py', 'trove/common/cfg.py', 'trove/taskmanager/manager.py', 'trove/taskmanager/models.py', 'trove/common/strategies/cluster/experimental/vertica/guestagent.py', 'trove/common/utils.py'], 'message': 'Use datastore specific timeouts if they exists

Reasons:
- If one taskmanager is managing multiple datastores it becomes
  mandatory to setup the usage_timeout/cluster_usage_timeout
  to be the highest value to accommodate highest time-taking datastore.

Changes:
- Updates taskamanager to use datastore-specific usage_timeout,
  if one exists, otherwise use the default one.
- Updates mongodb and vertica cluster strategies to use
  datastore-specific cluster_usage_timeout, if one exists,
  otherwise use the default one.
- Updated usage_timeout from mysql and percona confs to be 600,
  as the integration tests do not work with previous value of 400 seconds.

Closes-Bug: #1432558
Closes-Bug: #1469989
Change-Id: If78dead1ea013ed7a807b4a9327056092ff7012a
'}]
commit_message:
Use datastore specific timeouts if they exists

Reasons:
- If one taskmanager is managing multiple datastores it becomes
  mandatory to setup the usage_timeout/cluster_usage_timeout
  to be the highest value to accommodate highest time-taking datastore.

Changes:
- Updates taskamanager to use datastore-specific usage_timeout,
  if one exists, otherwise use the default one.
- Updates mongodb and vertica cluster strategies to use
  datastore-specific cluster_usage_timeout, if one exists,
  otherwise use the default one.
- Updated usage_timeout from mysql and percona confs to be 600,
  as the integration tests do not work with previous value of 400 seconds.

Closes-Bug: #1432558
Closes-Bug: #1469989
Change-Id: If78dead1ea013ed7a807b4a9327056092ff7012a

commit_message:
User management for Vertica clusters and instances

As the spec specifies, changes were made to
enable user CRUD operations for Vertica clusters
and instances.

To associate a user with a cluster, changes to the
user api. The previous UserController was replaced
with a DatastoreUserController interface that the
VerticaUserController and the MySQLUserController
both implement. The interface has methods for
managing users on both instances and clusters.

Change-Id: I21ebdc8e6ae896ad8241ad296fbb07db862cfd72
Implements blueprint: cluster-user-management

commit_message:
Custom Flavors For Config Servers and Routers

adds configurations for setting config-server flavor as well
as the query-router flavor for mongodb clusters. prior to this
patch, the routers and config-servers would inherit the flavor
chosen for the instances, which is an extremely inefficient
use of resources.

Change-Id: Iac0803401c30141f5e9d9544bf982597647092d9
Implements: blueprint clustering-sizing

This patch starts to move Trove usage of Heat to native Heat templates
and OpenStack resources.

Changes include:

- use native HOT functions to resolve resources and parameters
- use native OpenStack volume and volume attachment resources
- use native OpenStack server resource

As a consequence of the latter, Trove images no longer should require

Implements: blueprint native-os-heat-resources
"}]
commit_message:
Use native Heat template format and resources

This patch starts to move Trove usage of Heat to native Heat templates
and OpenStack resources.

Changes include:
- use native HOT syntax for the template
- use native HOT functions to resolve resources and parameters
- use native OpenStack volume and volume attachment resources
- use native OpenStack server resource

As a consequence of the latter, Trove images no longer should require
heat-cfntools package, boot config is done purely via cloud-init.
*Warning* - the default login name to the instance might no longer
be 'ec2-user' and depends on actual cloud image used.

The resources left untouched are security group and floating ip plus
association as currently in Heat only those AWS-compat resources
support both Nova-network and Neutron backends transparently.

Change-Id: I9bcdf234ccd3881f1ab836542c689da44d592e1c
Implements: blueprint native-os-heat-resources

commit_message:
Add instance metadata functionality to trove

Instance metadata is a feature that has been requested frequently by
Trove users. They need a way to store critical information for their
instances and have that be associated with the instance so that it is
displayed whenever that instance is listed via the API.

This also becomes very usable from a testing perspective when doing
integration/CI. The metadata can be utilized to store things like what
process created the instance, what the instance is being used for, etc.

The following calls have been implemented to facilitate metadata
support:

  create
  delete
  list
  show
  edit
  update

Implements: blueprint trove-metadata

Author: Daniel Salinas <imsplitbit@gmail.com>

Co-Authored-By: Joe Cruz <joe.cruz@rackspace.com>
Co-Authored-By: Denis Makogon <dmakogon@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Peter Stachowski <peter@tesora.com>

Change-Id: I1925b58b0ead307babe57d0ee28dcb5449fd6ce5

[{'number': 20, 'created': '2015-02-02 12:31:27.000000000', 'files': ['trove/taskmanager/models.py', 'trove/tests/unittests/taskmanager/test_models.py'], 'message': "Fix poll_until retriever while creating an instance

Reasons:
 - When instance is being launched Trove-Taskmanager tries
   to define Trove instance status and Compute Instance status.
   But if heat provisioning was enabled, Trove should check status
   of its Instance only since _create_server_volume_heat finishes
   with stack that's already in appropriate state - no need to check
   Compute Instance status at all.
 - Since taskmanager waiting for stack status
   'CREATE_COMPLETE'/'CREATE_FAILED' at provisioning,
   no need to pull Compute Instance status inside poll_until, because
   for heat-based provisioning is enough to poll
   and verify Instance Service status;
 - Taskmanager should block following provisioning
    steps of received compute instance is not ACTIVE.

Changes:
 - removing _service_is_active method;
 - splitting _service_is_active into:
   - _check_trove_instance_is_active;
   - _check_compute_instance_is_active.
 - updating _create_server method to poll compute instance status
   until it's ACTIVE or fail with appropriate exception;
 - updating poller to ask only for Trove instance status after
   stack/instance was created and in ACTIVE state.
 - _verify_compute_instance_is_active method was added to:
   - _create_server_volume;
   - _create_server_volume_individually;

Change-Id: I63cfde596c15208563640d199f1d4a50bc1db668
Closes-Bug: #1325512
"}]
commit_message:
Fix poll_until retriever while creating an instance

Reasons:
 - When instance is being launched Trove-Taskmanager tries
   to define Trove instance status and Compute Instance status.
   But if heat provisioning was enabled, Trove should check status
   of its Instance only since _create_server_volume_heat finishes
   with stack that's already in appropriate state - no need to check
   Compute Instance status at all.
 - Since taskmanager waiting for stack status
   'CREATE_COMPLETE'/'CREATE_FAILED' at provisioning,
   no need to pull Compute Instance status inside poll_until, because
   for heat-based provisioning is enough to poll
   and verify Instance Service status;
 - Taskmanager should block following provisioning
    steps of received compute instance is not ACTIVE.

Changes:
 - removing _service_is_active method;
 - splitting _service_is_active into:
   - _check_trove_instance_is_active;
   - _check_compute_instance_is_active.
 - updating _create_server method to poll compute instance status
   until it's ACTIVE or fail with appropriate exception;
 - updating poller to ask only for Trove instance status after
   stack/instance was created and in ACTIVE state.
 - _verify_compute_instance_is_active method was added to:
   - _create_server_volume;
   - _create_server_volume_individually;

Change-Id: I63cfde596c15208563640d199f1d4a50bc1db668
Closes-Bug: #1325512

commit_message:
Corrects error message for user-access-revoke

Reasons:
- Before revoking the requested database access, current code checks
  whether user has intended access, in the absence of which, service
  prompts the wrong message to user, that database does not exists.
- The error is raised as HTTP 422, unprocessable.

Changes:
- Added new HTTP 422 access forbidden exception to
  inform the lack of access.
- Unit-tests added.
- Integration test updated to verify HTTP-422.

Change-Id: Ifc3010c20324e05a002f674865150c96c331fde3
Closes-Bug: #1302405

commit_message:
Readonly functional tests in trove CLI

This patch implements readonly functional tests using trove CLI.
All the unit tests are moved to "unit" directory under "tests" directory.
Functional tests are under "functional" directory under "tests".
Implements: blueprint functional-test-coverage

commit_message:
Adding licensing support for clusters and instances

Introducing licensing support by creating a separate
top level resource for licenses. This would allow
users to BYOL (bring your own license) and to associate
licenses with a particular datastore version.

Change-Id: Ia8b5f920fcc48df0de5dab52166aeab38b67d2a2
Blueprint: trove-license-installation

commit_message:
Make Rsync For Guest Optional

add additional elements in trove-integration to stage the trove code
and trove-guestagent.conf for the guest in the extra-data.d hook, and
subsequently install them in the install.d hook, vs. relying on
upstart/systemd to rsync it.

Change-Id: I960c4cf415ca427df07c48865f1ebc9e20a548a9
Implements: blueprint rsync-optional

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-09 22:26:22.000000000', 'files': ['trove/guestagent/datastore/experimental/postgresql/service/config.py'], 'message': "Support CentOS in postgresql config.py path

The PGSQL_CONFIG and PSQL_HBA_CONFIG values need specific
assignment for the 'redhat' family (CentOS, RHEL, Fedora).
The locations of those conf files are defaulted to their
normal location after a call to initdb (/var/lib/pgsql/data).

Change-Id: Ib27f1052291f3ef57e967db7393e70821a7e350e
Closes-Bug: #1442387
"}]
commit_message:
Support CentOS in postgresql config.py path

The PGSQL_CONFIG and PSQL_HBA_CONFIG values need specific
assignment for the 'redhat' family (CentOS, RHEL, Fedora).
The locations of those conf files are defaulted to their
normal location after a call to initdb (/var/lib/pgsql/data).

Change-Id: Ib27f1052291f3ef57e967db7393e70821a7e350e
Closes-Bug: #1442387

subject: Adds guest-exception-handler to resize-volume
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-08 11:12:29.000000000', 'files': ['trove/taskmanager/models.py', 'trove/tests/unittests/taskmanager/test_models.py'], 'message': 'Adds guest-exception-handler to resize-volume

- In the absence of the exception handler block in resize-volume-execute
  method, the trove guest was not returning to it original state
  in case of a failure of any guest-methods,
  like if stop_db fails instance gets stuck in resize state.

- Adds the exception handler block to handle any GuestError.
- Removes the status checking block from the same method,
  as there was no purpose of this part because instance is pre-validated
  before sending a resize call for its "ACTIVE" state,
  in simple words, if instance status was not "ACTIVE"
  code will not flow till this point.
- Removes the test which was testing the execute method raising exception
  when called with an instance in ERROR state.

Change-Id: I538513552531f6d302c037b3ae9a315e6bbe2008
Closes-Bug: #1441558
'}]
commit_message:
Adds guest-exception-handler to resize-volume

- In the absence of the exception handler block in resize-volume-execute
  method, the trove guest was not returning to it original state
  in case of a failure of any guest-methods,
  like if stop_db fails instance gets stuck in resize state.

- Adds the exception handler block to handle any GuestError.
- Removes the status checking block from the same method,
  as there was no purpose of this part because instance is pre-validated
  before sending a resize call for its "ACTIVE" state,
  in simple words, if instance status was not "ACTIVE"
  code will not flow till this point.
- Removes the test which was testing the execute method raising exception
  when called with an instance in ERROR state.

Change-Id: I538513552531f6d302c037b3ae9a315e6bbe2008
Closes-Bug: #1441558

management, mgmt_cluster, accounts, mgmt_config_params.

subject: Remove quotes from subshell call in tools/with_venv.sh
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-07 13:20:37.000000000', 'files': ['tools/with_venv.sh'], 'message': 'Remove quotes from subshell call in tools/with_venv.sh

Always no quotes for $() statement.

We don't need quotes to hold blanks in result:
 # i=$(echo 1 2 3)
 # echo $i
 1 2 3
 #

These quotes can make something wrong in some case:
 # i=$(echo '!')
 #
 # i="$(echo '!')"
 -bash: !: event not found
 #

No real problem for current code in with_venv.sh, only to use a
better code style.

Change-Id: Ic0d613235fbfeb3c6aed93c55cbb8fd117b365c4
Signed-off-by: Zhao Lei <zhaolei@cn.fujitsu.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Remove quotes from subshell call in tools/with_venv.sh

Always no quotes for $() statement.

We don't need quotes to hold blanks in result:
 # i=$(echo 1 2 3)
 # echo $i
 1 2 3
 #

These quotes can make something wrong in some case:
 # i=$(echo '!')
 #
 # i="$(echo '!')"
 -bash: !: event not found
 #

No real problem for current code in with_venv.sh, only to use a
better code style.

Change-Id: Ic0d613235fbfeb3c6aed93c55cbb8fd117b365c4
Signed-off-by: Zhao Lei <zhaolei@cn.fujitsu.com>

subject: Allow user to select zone for their trove volume
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-08-07 01:44:22.000000000', 'files': ['trove/common/cfg.py', 'trove/tests/fakes/nova.py', 'trove/taskmanager/models.py'], 'message': "Allow user to select zone for their trove volume

In multi cinder zone environment, trove have volume-type support,
but does not have zone support.For Instance,if I have two cinder zone:dmz,dev
and two kind of volume in each zone:ssd,ceph.
If I only want to create trove volume in my dmz zone ssd volume , Now I cant't.
I have to reconfigure cinder to create a new volume type
to distinguish ssd in dmz from ssd others, it's very uncomfortable.

Change-Id: I4d9aeaca1cecbe5e6d4ce31eaf8802c65596e581
Closes-Bug: #1482162
"}]
commit_message:
Allow user to select zone for their trove volume

In multi cinder zone environment, trove have volume-type support,
but does not have zone support.For Instance,if I have two cinder zone:dmz,dev
and two kind of volume in each zone:ssd,ceph.
If I only want to create trove volume in my dmz zone ssd volume , Now I cant't.
I have to reconfigure cinder to create a new volume type
to distinguish ssd in dmz from ssd others, it's very uncomfortable.

Change-Id: I4d9aeaca1cecbe5e6d4ce31eaf8802c65596e581
Closes-Bug: #1482162

commit_message:
Add support for Microsoft SQL Server datastore in Trove

Add Microsoft SQL Server datastore for Trove in addition to the
existing datastores currently supported.

The guestagent will run on Windows and include functions
like launch, terminate, resize instance and more advanced features,
like backup, restore, clustering and replication.

Blueprint: mssql-server-db-support

subject: New release for pylockfile
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-11-25 18:16:55.000000000', 'files': ['deliverables/mitaka/pylockfile.yaml'], 'message': "New release for pylockfile

Next attempt at releasing pylockfile. 0.12.0 and
0.12.1 did not end up on pypi.

0.12.0 - pypi-extract-universal.py used an old config option
         [wheel]/universal and did not support the newer
         [bdist_wheel/universal. We tried to fix this in
         change id:
         I519acfc3080938fe0445705fc98df12201036c30
         I68b0cd547caf0c9161c983e7dc0f2259a96af762
0.12.1 - We tried this with the same SHA which failed again
         as there was a typo in the previous change. The new
         fix as made in:
         I68b0cd547caf0c9161c983e7dc0f2259a96af762

Another problem was that gate-releases-tox-validate was
tripping when we used the same SHA for 0.12.0 and 0.12.1
So we touched up the README.rst of pylockfile to change
the SHA to make a new release for 0.12.2. Also, since
0.12.0 and 0.12.1 did not end up on pypi, we don't need
to list them here as well.

Change-Id: I8a94287a09c4ebbb5f5cbb661750a9d9cc5e036d
"}]
commit_message:
New release for pylockfile

Next attempt at releasing pylockfile. 0.12.0 and
0.12.1 did not end up on pypi.

0.12.0 - pypi-extract-universal.py used an old config option
         [wheel]/universal and did not support the newer
         [bdist_wheel/universal. We tried to fix this in
         change id:
         I519acfc3080938fe0445705fc98df12201036c30
         I68b0cd547caf0c9161c983e7dc0f2259a96af762
0.12.1 - We tried this with the same SHA which failed again
         as there was a typo in the previous change. The new
         fix as made in:
         I68b0cd547caf0c9161c983e7dc0f2259a96af762

Another problem was that gate-releases-tox-validate was
tripping when we used the same SHA for 0.12.0 and 0.12.1
So we touched up the README.rst of pylockfile to change
the SHA to make a new release for 0.12.2. Also, since
0.12.0 and 0.12.1 did not end up on pypi, we don't need
to list them here as well.

Change-Id: I8a94287a09c4ebbb5f5cbb661750a9d9cc5e036d

subject: Use sudo for role testing
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-11-25 18:15:11.000000000', 'files': ['tests/ansible.cfg', 'tests/inventory'], 'message': "Use sudo for role testing

There are 2 ways to realize the privilege escalation
needed for the gate jobs.

1) Editing the playbooks (and hope to not forget to
write the sudo/become lines for every role)
2) Editing the inventory and set the variable there.

I'm taking the second approach with the minimum set
of variables (become_method is sudo by default and
become_user is root by default).

Change-Id: I54b8c1489bfc46d4a03c907f4a86f0313c7778ff
"}]
commit_message:
Use sudo for role testing

There are 2 ways to realize the privilege escalation
needed for the gate jobs.

1) Editing the playbooks (and hope to not forget to
write the sudo/become lines for every role)
2) Editing the inventory and set the variable there.

I'm taking the second approach with the minimum set
of variables (become_method is sudo by default and
become_user is root by default).

Change-Id: I54b8c1489bfc46d4a03c907f4a86f0313c7778ff

commit_message:
Revert "Clean up spec files in horizon framework directory"

This change appears to have made phantomJS crash quite
sporadically in the gate.

This reverts commit fab9cf6fd11aafd0f0d3a3063628895503dc1da8.

Change-Id: I35ab11f6bf55b5c680ba4e0ebacfcbd84a8ef543

commit_message:
Remove the TestRemoteObject class

This class is now testing only things that exist (and are tested) in
oslo.versionedobjects. Remove this class from what we test in nova.

Change-Id: I2e64f5917fb83eaa29970388359ef29db44f0e0b

commit_message:
ovs: Make interface name hashing algorithm common and extend it

The OVS device name hashing algorithm shortens interface names that are too
long. To ensure uniqueness it makes use of a hashing algorithm.

Move this function to a common place where it can be shared between ml2
drivers and agents.

Extend the function to support defining the max device length to be used.

Change LOG level to info to help deployers figuring out the unhashed name
of an hashed inteface.

Adapt OVS agent to use this common function instead of its
own implementation.

Change-Id: I5c04f39928d070aa7e372934fcb2675609d2761c
Partial-Bug: #1495960

According to [1],the correct usage is to call stop() before wait(), so in
mistral case, we should never call stop() and wait() in initialization of
engine and executor service.

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.messaging/notification_listener.html

Change-Id: Ic6a802bff35a6a6fdfadf38474782efd12fd34d8

(cherry picked from commit ec28a305d91139ef5d307fa56ad289a635e37a90)
'}]
commit_message:
Removing wait() when initializing notification listener

According to [1],the correct usage is to call stop() before wait(), so in
mistral case, we should never call stop() and wait() in initialization of
engine and executor service.

[1]:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.messaging/notification_listener.html

Change-Id: Ic6a802bff35a6a6fdfadf38474782efd12fd34d8
Closes-Bug: #1514459
(cherry picked from commit ec28a305d91139ef5d307fa56ad289a635e37a90)

subject: Fix state change on exception during task state change
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-25 06:49:08.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_direct_workflow.py', 'mistral/engine/default_engine.py'], 'message': 'Fix state change on exception during task state change

If there is an exception during on_task_state_change, particularly if
there is a YAQL evaluation error in the input of the next task, the state
of the current task and related action execution will be marked ERROR for
sync task and rolled back for async task, leaving the task as orphaned in
RUNNING state in most cases. This is a workflow handling error and the
workflow execution state is already marked ERROR. The state of the current
task execution should not be affected.

Change-Id: Id28b0661c09efa80a666d9eb7606fb435641a989
Closes-Bug: #1510738
(cherry picked from commit 93b19335f5992f74ac0edcd4f95c0ad06d101b74)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix state change on exception during task state change

If there is an exception during on_task_state_change, particularly if
there is a YAQL evaluation error in the input of the next task, the state
of the current task and related action execution will be marked ERROR for
sync task and rolled back for async task, leaving the task as orphaned in
RUNNING state in most cases. This is a workflow handling error and the
workflow execution state is already marked ERROR. The state of the current
task execution should not be affected.

Change-Id: Id28b0661c09efa80a666d9eb7606fb435641a989
Closes-Bug: #1510738
(cherry picked from commit 93b19335f5992f74ac0edcd4f95c0ad06d101b74)

commit_message:
Only log errors in exceptions on demand

Rather than error logging all of them, allow the user a mechanism
to error log the ones they care about. Also make inner_exception
public so that people can make their own choices.

Change-Id: I15973f52d3d68c24ac8ef7643a53ff0118e892cf

subject: Update requirements to suit the existence of lxc vg
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-19 15:29:25.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/developer-docs/quickstart-aio.rst'], 'message': "Update requirements to suit the existence of lxc vg

If lxc volume group exists, the aio will try to use
this volume group to create the containers.

As one container will use a hard 5GB of storage, and
the fact that (by default) there is more than 16
containers, you'll exhaust all your storage space
and the aio build will fail.

This commit should make this failure more clear to
openstack-ansible users.

The amount of disk is counted with the default
install.

Change-Id: I84f68a24423f9e7046b1235ef51bf2291708fcec
(cherry picked from commit dfc544fed974c81d7542ff8167d6a4143914c79c)
"}]
commit_message:
Update requirements to suit the existence of lxc vg

If lxc volume group exists, the aio will try to use
this volume group to create the containers.

As one container will use a hard 5GB of storage, and
the fact that (by default) there is more than 16
containers, you'll exhaust all your storage space
and the aio build will fail.

This commit should make this failure more clear to
openstack-ansible users.

The amount of disk is counted with the default
install.

Change-Id: I84f68a24423f9e7046b1235ef51bf2291708fcec
(cherry picked from commit dfc544fed974c81d7542ff8167d6a4143914c79c)

Provides a simple mechanism to verify the correct certificates
landed.

A quick and simple way to verify SSL certificates were generated for

commit_message:
Output the SSL Certificate and Key modulus

Provides a simple mechanism to verify the correct certificates
landed.

A quick and simple way to verify SSL certificates were generated for
a given key is by comparing the modulus of the two.  By outputing
the key modulus and certificate modulus we offer a way to verify
that the right cert and key have been deployed without compromising
any of the secrets.

Change-Id: I882c9840719a09795ba8057a19b0b3985e036c3c

commit_message:
Enable trust anchor injection

This commit enables the injection of a trust anchor or root
certificate into every node in the overcloud. This is in case that the
TLS certificates for the controllers are signed with a self-signed CA
or if the deployer would like to inject a relevant root certificate
for other purposes. In this case the other nodes might need to have
the root certificate in their trust chain in order to do proper
validation

Change-Id: Ia45180fe0bb979cf12d19f039dbfd22e26fb4856

commit_message:
Inject TLS certificate and keys for the Overcloud

This is a first implementation of adding TLS termination to the load
balancer in the controllers. The implementation was made so that the
appropriate certificate/private key in PEM format is copied to the
appropriate controller(s) via a software deployment resource.

And the path is then referenced on the HAProxy configuration, but this
part was left commented out because we need to be able to configure the
keystone endpoints in order for this to work properly.

Change-Id: I0ba8e38d75a0c628d8132a66dc25a30fc5183c79

subject: Use sudo for role testing
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-11-25 12:35:43.000000000', 'files': ['tests/ansible.cfg', 'tests/inventory'], 'message': "Use sudo for role testing

There are 2 ways to realize the privilege escalation needed
for the gate jobs.

1) Editing the playbooks (and hope to not forget to write the
sudo/become lines for every role)
2) Editing the inventory and set the variable there.

I'm taking the second approach with the minimum
set of variables (become_method is sudo by default
and become_user is root by default).

Change-Id: I4f7d423ad2d21611c466ec6bb58d45c5a2fd00b9
"}]
commit_message:
Use sudo for role testing

There are 2 ways to realize the privilege escalation needed
for the gate jobs.

1) Editing the playbooks (and hope to not forget to write the
sudo/become lines for every role)
2) Editing the inventory and set the variable there.

I'm taking the second approach with the minimum
set of variables (become_method is sudo by default
and become_user is root by default).

Change-Id: I4f7d423ad2d21611c466ec6bb58d45c5a2fd00b9

commit_message:
config options: remove invalid help text assignment

config options help texts won't get translated. This patch set
removes the translation helper. It also removes the assignment
of a help text as a tuple.

Change-Id: Iecea9576154fef8e1d4d8f3d2635bbb30cad2f7f

subject: Remove 'sqlalchemy' from requirements.txt
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-25 16:35:29.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'message': "Remove 'sqlalchemy' from requirements.txt

Having that requirement here can cause installation problems - please
see the bug for details.

networking-calico does use sqlalchemy, but it works fine to allow it
to be pulled in by Neutron, and so not to depend explicitly upon it.

Change-Id: I21b17844df0c369d743e18c9bfd41fc4255b4b3e
Closes-Bug: #1519884
"}]
commit_message:
Remove 'sqlalchemy' from requirements.txt

Having that requirement here can cause installation problems - please
see the bug for details.

networking-calico does use sqlalchemy, but it works fine to allow it
to be pulled in by Neutron, and so not to depend explicitly upon it.

Change-Id: I21b17844df0c369d743e18c9bfd41fc4255b4b3e
Closes-Bug: #1519884

subject: Handle NO_DOMAIN status
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-11 19:22:31.000000000', 'files': ['designate/central/service.py', 'designate/pool_manager/service.py'], 'message': "Handle NO_DOMAIN status

Previous to this patch, when MiniDNS got a `NO_DOMAIN` status back,
it didn't do anything to handle it. Domains just hung in ERROR.

closes-bug: #1416264

Conflicts:
	designate/tests/unit/test_central/test_basic.py

Change-Id: I4348f714868f38c2549c516fe83cce608c0c8d59
(cherry picked from commit ed2861a0193e2b5ebbb89a8d8fb04fdded976483)
"}]
commit_message:
Handle NO_DOMAIN status

Previous to this patch, when MiniDNS got a `NO_DOMAIN` status back,
it didn't do anything to handle it. Domains just hung in ERROR.

closes-bug: #1416264

Conflicts:
	designate/tests/unit/test_central/test_basic.py

Change-Id: I4348f714868f38c2549c516fe83cce608c0c8d59
(cherry picked from commit ed2861a0193e2b5ebbb89a8d8fb04fdded976483)

subject: Remove ssh args to ensure pipelining is working
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-24 18:15:57.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/ansible.cfg'], 'message': 'Remove ssh args to ensure pipelining is working

The ssh args that we have been carrying are overriding
base functionality in Ansible which can cause intermitent
issues. To correct this issue I removed our ssh-args which
will use the default ssh arguments provided by ansible core.

Change-Id: If61d875a58e466ec07cb6818040e83f1612b4f18
Related-Bug: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/9246
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Remove ssh args to ensure pipelining is working

The ssh args that we have been carrying are overriding
base functionality in Ansible which can cause intermitent
issues. To correct this issue I removed our ssh-args which
will use the default ssh arguments provided by ansible core.

Change-Id: If61d875a58e466ec07cb6818040e83f1612b4f18
Related-Bug: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/9246
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: Use sudo for role testing
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-11-25 16:34:26.000000000', 'files': ['tests/ansible.cfg', 'tests/inventory'], 'message': "Use sudo for role testing

There are 2 ways to realize the privilege escalation
needed for the gate jobs.

1) Editing the playbooks (and hope to not forget to
write the sudo/become lines for every role)
2) Editing the inventory and set the variable there.

I'm taking the second approach with the minimum set
of variables (become_method is sudo by default and
become_user is root by default).

Change-Id: Iab4a1deda78669fd2a5e3e18c5b86afdffde0cf8
"}]
commit_message:
Use sudo for role testing

There are 2 ways to realize the privilege escalation
needed for the gate jobs.

1) Editing the playbooks (and hope to not forget to
write the sudo/become lines for every role)
2) Editing the inventory and set the variable there.

I'm taking the second approach with the minimum set
of variables (become_method is sudo by default and
become_user is root by default).

Change-Id: Iab4a1deda78669fd2a5e3e18c5b86afdffde0cf8

subject: Rename semantic-version dep to semantic_version
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-24 17:00:48.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Rename semantic-version dep to semantic_version

The package is actually named semantic_version, not semantic-version. This is
known to cause errors in old pip versions and with non standard setups,
so lets name it correctly.

Change-Id: Ie5709ccc9d67ee221c2c00d6202f8e48b66da80e
'}]
commit_message:
Rename semantic-version dep to semantic_version

The package is actually named semantic_version, not semantic-version. This is
known to cause errors in old pip versions and with non standard setups,
so lets name it correctly.

Change-Id: Ie5709ccc9d67ee221c2c00d6202f8e48b66da80e

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-25 14:40:22.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/utils/__init__.py', 'mistral/tests/functional/engine/actions/v2/test_ssh_actions.py', 'doc/source/dsl/dsl_v2.rst', 'functionaltests/run_tests.sh', 'mistral/utils/ssh_utils.py', 'mistral/actions/std_actions.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/utils/test_utils.py', 'functionaltests/post_test_hook.sh'], 'message': "Fixing SSH actions to use names of private keys

 * SSH action uses private key names instead of
   private keys themself. All private keys now
   should be in <user-home>/.ssh/, e.g. searching
   of key 'my_key.pem' will be at <user-home>/.ssh/my_key.pem
 * Fixed functional tests
 * Remove sudo while running tests

Closes-Bug: #1507600

Change-Id: I503d78ff541183ce850476229842fa6f20061a00
(cherry picked from commit 56f2d5f4b5603f457e6b4eb5b0a699471b658f9c)
"}]
commit_message:
Fixing SSH actions to use names of private keys

 * SSH action uses private key names instead of
   private keys themself. All private keys now
   should be in <user-home>/.ssh/, e.g. searching
   of key 'my_key.pem' will be at <user-home>/.ssh/my_key.pem
 * Fixed functional tests
 * Remove sudo while running tests

Closes-Bug: #1507600

Change-Id: I503d78ff541183ce850476229842fa6f20061a00
(cherry picked from commit 56f2d5f4b5603f457e6b4eb5b0a699471b658f9c)

subject: Handle concurrent deletion in periodic resync thread
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-25 13:58:46.000000000', 'files': ['networking_calico/plugins/ml2/drivers/calico/mech_calico.py'], 'message': 'Handle concurrent deletion in periodic resync thread

See https://github.com/projectcalico/calico/issues/914 for full
discussion.  In summary, for this scenario we need to catch
EtcdKeyNotFound as well as EtcdCompareFailed.

commit_message:
Handle concurrent deletion in periodic resync thread

See https://github.com/projectcalico/calico/issues/914 for full
discussion.  In summary, for this scenario we need to catch
EtcdKeyNotFound as well as EtcdCompareFailed.

Change-Id: I49652e33639a68c1a68c162bc57b240fbdd0181b
Closes-Bug: #1519795

commit_message:
cleanup sahara commands

this change will migrate the "sahara" process name to "sahara-all" to
provide greater clarity on what service process is running.

* change start process to sahara-all
* change stop process to sahara-all
* add a sahara-all detection to is_service_enabled
* remove dirname usage in favor of GITDIR environment variable for the
  shutdown script

Change-Id: I80b82edbc6023d4dc28f005fecd8f2138809bbe3

commit_message:
Support shares in sahara cluster templates

Since 0.10.0 python-saharaclient has ability to specify
shares parameter when creating cluster templates.
This patch adds support for this feature to
OS::Sahara::ClusterTemplate resource in Heat.

Change-Id: I44533f79cc8e95e6c41edf08f54f86370d6fd5e2

commit_message:
Decrypting Container Listing

See encryption spec in_progress/at_rest_encryption.html

Decrypts the content-type in the container-listing.
The content-length is modified since decoding decreases length.
When there is "footers" support, the etag will also be decrypted.

Depends on having keymaster middleware and cryptography module.
You can point the following vagrant to this patch:
https://github.com/swiftstack/vagrant-swift-all-in-one/tree/crypto
Alternatively, please follow the instructions
in the proxy-server.conf-sample.  You will also need to add the
fake_footers middleware as well to get the correct functionality.

Co-Authored-By: Alistair Coles <alistair.coles@hp.com>

Change-Id: If7830ed0fc17deb3939492a02a3e07a20f1018c7

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-19 16:06:34.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/token/providers/fernet/token_formatters.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/token/test_fernet_provider.py'], 'message': 'Rename fernet methods to match expiration timestamp

Fernet tokens carry the token creation time as part of the Fernet
specification, which is an integer. This is not the case with the token
expiration time, which is carried in the payload of the Fernet token. Keystone
converts the timestamp to a floating point value to save space in the token.
Previously, all the methods handling this conversion, along with the related
tests, communicated that this conversion was to an integer instead of a
float. This change corrects the methods signatures in the Fernet token provider
to be consistent with the timestamp type that is used in the implementation.

Conflicts:
	keystone/token/providers/fernet/token_formatters.py

Change-Id: Ibea9fa0d546948501ebcd9f9f826b1f1319246f2
(cherry picked from commit 94904b305b74e4e9e1b70b7c6e1351febdd6862d)
'}]
commit_message:
Rename fernet methods to match expiration timestamp

Fernet tokens carry the token creation time as part of the Fernet
specification, which is an integer. This is not the case with the token
expiration time, which is carried in the payload of the Fernet token. Keystone
converts the timestamp to a floating point value to save space in the token.
Previously, all the methods handling this conversion, along with the related
tests, communicated that this conversion was to an integer instead of a
float. This change corrects the methods signatures in the Fernet token provider
to be consistent with the timestamp type that is used in the implementation.

Conflicts:
	keystone/token/providers/fernet/token_formatters.py

Change-Id: Ibea9fa0d546948501ebcd9f9f826b1f1319246f2
(cherry picked from commit 94904b305b74e4e9e1b70b7c6e1351febdd6862d)

commit_message:
Optimize router delete execution

Optimize the execution of router delete in the L3 agent
by not performing operations in the router namespace that
will be removed as the last step of the workflow.
Comparing the slopes of the least squares fit of delete
execution time shows that this optimization decreases that
slope by over half.

Change-Id: Ic425ab1f8c3afe882c9deaa72a814ac0d2053f3b
Signed-off-by: Ryan Moats <rmoats@us.ibm.com>
Closes-Bug: 1512450

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2015-11-16 06:07:34.000000000', 'files': ['doc/manpages/swift-init.1', 'swift/common/manager.py', 'test/unit/common/test_manager.py', 'bin/swift-init'], 'message': "swift-init return codes

Currently, swift-init returns zero if can't locate config on start.
Because of this problem, it is not possible to distinguish if managed
to start server.

Due to legacy two new complementary options are added. Default is context
dependent.
--strict returns non-zero if some config is missing (default mode
if explicitly named server)
--non-strict returns zero even if some config is missing (default mode
if alias is used)

As a side effect:
If some of demanded servers already running it does not try to start
unstarted and also returns non-zero (in strict mode). That is still sufficient
for the goal of patch.

For future improvements LSB status codes should be considered.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I7750abd4a94875b46f83f4aeee8509388d543c2b
"}]
commit_message:
swift-init return codes

Currently, swift-init returns zero if can't locate config on start.
Because of this problem, it is not possible to distinguish if managed
to start server.

Due to legacy two new complementary options are added. Default is context
dependent.
--strict returns non-zero if some config is missing (default mode
if explicitly named server)
--non-strict returns zero even if some config is missing (default mode
if alias is used)

As a side effect:
If some of demanded servers already running it does not try to start
unstarted and also returns non-zero (in strict mode). That is still sufficient
for the goal of patch.

For future improvements LSB status codes should be considered.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I7750abd4a94875b46f83f4aeee8509388d543c2b

subject: Fix releasenotes post job
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-11-21 06:04:15.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/openstack-publish-jobs.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/macros.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Fix releasenotes post job

Use zuul-git-branch-prep macro, the branch-git-prep does not work in the
post queue (gerrit-git-prep script still gets ZUUL_BRANCH and checks out
a stable branch instead of desired master) to check out master as
intented.

Using zuul-git-branch-prep we can now for any change publish the release
notes from *master*.

This fixes also zuul-git-branch-prep, we need to properly quote the
function.

Also, only run the job on liberty and newer branches - incl. master - since
older branches do not have reno based releasenotes entries.

Change-Id: Icce6440278c6606528f8f601da76b2af0a1f12e9
'}]
commit_message:
Fix releasenotes post job

Use zuul-git-branch-prep macro, the branch-git-prep does not work in the
post queue (gerrit-git-prep script still gets ZUUL_BRANCH and checks out
a stable branch instead of desired master) to check out master as
intented.

Using zuul-git-branch-prep we can now for any change publish the release
notes from *master*.

This fixes also zuul-git-branch-prep, we need to properly quote the
function.

Also, only run the job on liberty and newer branches - incl. master - since
older branches do not have reno based releasenotes entries.

Change-Id: Icce6440278c6606528f8f601da76b2af0a1f12e9

commit_message:
Configure etcd DB location

Determine the etcd DB file location in order to know how to clean
it on stack.
This eliminate the problems when the start_db_server method is
moved.

Change-Id: I4965211e8c748266c0e36ccaed7f348617ed272f

subject: [WIP] Rewrote the Ansible SSH plugin
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-25 01:09:00.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/plugins/connection/ssh.py', 'playbooks/ansible.cfg'], 'message': '[WIP] Rewrote the Ansible SSH plugin

In Ansible 1.9.x there are a few areas where the SSH plugin
could / should be updated to better support the systems it
interacts with. This PR updated the SSH connection plugin
such that it is now smarter in how the various methods write, 
update, and modifies data in flight while also being more

Change-Id: I60d4962d31024109f3aa610173fb3e068aaeadbb
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>'}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Rewrote the Ansible SSH plugin

In Ansible 1.9.x there are a few areas where the SSH plugin
could / should be updated to better support the systems it
interacts with. This PR updated the SSH connection plugin
such that it is now smarter in how the various methods write, 
update, and modifies data in flight while also being more 
pythonic / easy to read.

Change-Id: I60d4962d31024109f3aa610173fb3e068aaeadbb
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: Set ext[234] images superblock timestamps to a distant past
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-11-22 16:24:13.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_agent/tests/test_build_utils.py', 'fuel_agent/utils/build.py', 'fuel_agent/utils/fs.py'], 'message': 'Set ext[234] images superblock timestamps to a distant past

e2fsck is very picky about timestamps: the last write time being in the future
considered an error. Thus provisioning an image on a machine which is not
syncronised with the one where the image has been built requires extra
effort (creating a custom /etc/e2fsck.conf file) and might possibly affect
the regular filesystems checks (during the OS boot).
To avoid the problem set the superblock timestamps of ext2/3/4 filesystems
images built by fuel-agent to a distant past.

* utils.fs: add functions for ext[234] superblock timestamps manipulation
* shrink_sparse_file: reset the superblock timestamps after resizing the image

Change-Id: Ifae51726aed4f221d7715ff9aa11310f9c540188
'}]
commit_message:
Set ext[234] images superblock timestamps to a distant past

e2fsck is very picky about timestamps: the last write time being in the future
considered an error. Thus provisioning an image on a machine which is not
syncronised with the one where the image has been built requires extra
effort (creating a custom /etc/e2fsck.conf file) and might possibly affect
the regular filesystems checks (during the OS boot).
To avoid the problem set the superblock timestamps of ext2/3/4 filesystems
images built by fuel-agent to a distant past.

* utils.fs: add functions for ext[234] superblock timestamps manipulation
* shrink_sparse_file: reset the superblock timestamps after resizing the image

Change-Id: Ifae51726aed4f221d7715ff9aa11310f9c540188

subject: utils.execute: implement passing input via 'process_input' kwarg
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-11-22 16:24:13.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_agent/utils/utils.py'], 'message': "utils.execute: implement passing input via 'process_input' kwarg

Being unable to pass an input to a command is a very annoying restriction.
For now the input can be passed to a single process only (as opposed to
a pipeline of commands).

Note: oslo_concurrency.processutils.execute uses the `process_input' keyword
argument for the same purpose, hence the name.

Change-Id: I448efad452519d3140832fb94ed7b783ae256613
"}]
commit_message:
utils.execute: implement passing input via 'process_input' kwarg

Being unable to pass an input to a command is a very annoying restriction.
For now the input can be passed to a single process only (as opposed to
a pipeline of commands).

Note: oslo_concurrency.processutils.execute uses the `process_input' keyword
argument for the same purpose, hence the name.

Change-Id: I448efad452519d3140832fb94ed7b783ae256613

subject: Kilo backport
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2015-11-25 14:06:47.000000000', 'files': ['networking_bgpvpn/tests/unit/extensions/test_bgpvpn.py', 'requirements.txt', 'tools/tox_install.sh', 'test-requirements.txt', 'setup.py', 'networking_bgpvpn/neutron/services/plugin.py', 'tox.ini', 'networking_bgpvpn/neutron/extensions/bgpvpn.py'], 'message': 'Kilo backport

Service_provider in neutron.conf
	In kilo it is not possible to add service
	provider config. Thats why the configuration has
	to be set in neutron.conf

Add namespace to extension
	In kilo an extension for neutron still
	needs a get_namespace method.

Hack around neutrons fixed plugin rules
	The list of allowed services is fixed in kilo.
	This commit adds BGPVPN to the allowed services.

Align unittests to kilo
	bgpvpn_id is given in kwargs not in args.

Align requirements to stable/kilo

	It is necessary to align the test-requirements
	to the main openstack projects.

Change-Id: I3b5fa02af73c6111d38a7e99f372e25e2e469510
'}]
commit_message:
Kilo backport

Service_provider in neutron.conf
	In kilo it is not possible to add service
	provider config. Thats why the configuration has
	to be set in neutron.conf

Add namespace to extension
	In kilo an extension for neutron still
	needs a get_namespace method.

Hack around neutrons fixed plugin rules
	The list of allowed services is fixed in kilo.
	This commit adds BGPVPN to the allowed services.

Align unittests to kilo
	bgpvpn_id is given in kwargs not in args.

Align requirements to stable/kilo

	It is necessary to align the test-requirements
	to the main openstack projects.

Change-Id: I3b5fa02af73c6111d38a7e99f372e25e2e469510

Move the code which actually makes compressed filesystem images

method. The next patch will implement the make_bootstrap_image
method which packs the OS as a bootstrap image, that is, a tarball

Implements: blueprint dynamically-build-bootstrap

commit_message:
do_build_image: move image creation to a helper method

Move the code which actually makes compressed filesystem images
of the installed/configured OS from do_build_image into a helper
method. The next patch will implement the make_bootstrap_image
method which packs the OS as a bootstrap image, that is, a tarball
containing a squashfs root filesystem, kernel, initramfs, and
a metadata.

Change-Id: Ia10056e70c060ca37515d0e03fce797fe3bed97d
Implements: blueprint dynamically-build-bootstrap
