subject: Various leader election improvements:
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-11-25 14:25:29.000000000', 'files': ['networking_calico/plugins/ml2/drivers/calico/mech_calico.py', 'networking_calico/plugins/ml2/drivers/calico/election.py', 'networking_calico/plugins/ml2/drivers/calico/test/test_election.py'], 'message': "Various leader election improvements:

* Reduce startup timer to reduce time without a leader after restart;
  this is sensible now that we're relying on leader election to
  nominate the status reporting thread.
* Opportunistically check if the previous master is still alive if
  we happen to start on the same server.  Reduces time to get a new
  master after restarting neutron.
* Add additional diags in hope of diagnosing election bouncing seen
  in #775 and #869.  Possible starvation of elector?

Change-Id: Ic84c8316a1cd26a77f3799ea0f4f96a2e438e987
Closes-Bug: #1519830
"}]
commit_message:
Various leader election improvements:

* Reduce startup timer to reduce time without a leader after restart;
  this is sensible now that we're relying on leader election to
  nominate the status reporting thread.
* Opportunistically check if the previous master is still alive if
  we happen to start on the same server.  Reduces time to get a new
  master after restarting neutron.
* Add additional diags in hope of diagnosing election bouncing seen
  in #775 and #869.  Possible starvation of elector?

Change-Id: Ic84c8316a1cd26a77f3799ea0f4f96a2e438e987
Closes-Bug: #1519830

subject: Fixed haproxy backend config issue
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-23 10:34:01.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/vars/configs/haproxy_config.yml'], 'message': 'Fixed haproxy backend config issue

The change updates the haproxy configs to use backends with a
default of an empty array. This is needed to ensure that the backends
are not being assumed to have some value. In the current system if an
inventory item did not exist the rendered backend would be a jinja
string which would cause the haproxy play to fail.

Closes-Bug: #1513455

Change-Id: I221dbd910c75c2e41c98a33e1c38c7f69718b544
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 589650228bb2678487b5750688fe403095955db7)
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed haproxy backend config issue

The change updates the haproxy configs to use backends with a
default of an empty array. This is needed to ensure that the backends
are not being assumed to have some value. In the current system if an
inventory item did not exist the rendered backend would be a jinja
string which would cause the haproxy play to fail.

Closes-Bug: #1513455

Change-Id: I221dbd910c75c2e41c98a33e1c38c7f69718b544
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Remove keystone directives from api-paste file

Remove next directives from api-paste authtoken section
and put them to cinder.conf instead:

* auth_uri
* auth_host
* auth_protocol
* auth_port
* admin_tenant_name
* admin_user
* admin_password
* identity_uri

Also there are some deleted fields cause they don't
uses anymore in config:

* service_host
* service_port
* service_protocol

Change-Id: Idab40f63e962293e59ac2cc2f7dc95ed474f74e6
Closes-Bug: #1500384

commit_message:
add comment explaining why we don't want extra values passed to mask_password

We have the same conversation every 6 months or so. Let's document our
reasoning here so folks are less likely to waste time adding new
arguments to the function and having their patch rejected.

Related-Bug: #1407811
Change-Id: I0d0a30a1256ddc34edce6c312abe9a53fa8ac7ae

subject: Fixes bug: wrong wmi call in vmutils._modify_virtual_system method
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-25 13:45:54.000000000', 'files': ['os_win/utils/compute/vmutils.py', 'os_win/tests/utils/compute/test_vmutils.py'], 'message': 'Fixes bug: wrong wmi call in vmutils._modify_virtual_system method

The method modify_virtual_system from vmutils calls ModifyVirtualSystem
method of the wmi class Msvm_VirtualSystemManagementService [1].
This is wrong since it is supported only in the virtualization\v1
namespace, not in v2.

The appropriate methods to call should be, ModifySystemSettings [2].

[1] https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/cc136809(v=vs.85).aspx
[2] https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/hh850104(v=vs.85).aspx

Change-Id: I5a454d2a31b81c54552328bcdd6bf473ea21d7ff
Closes-Bug: #1518889
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes bug: wrong wmi call in vmutils._modify_virtual_system method

The method modify_virtual_system from vmutils calls ModifyVirtualSystem
method of the wmi class Msvm_VirtualSystemManagementService [1].
This is wrong since it is supported only in the virtualization\v1
namespace, not in v2.

The appropriate methods to call should be, ModifySystemSettings [2].

[1] https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/cc136809(v=vs.85).aspx
[2] https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/hh850104(v=vs.85).aspx

Change-Id: I5a454d2a31b81c54552328bcdd6bf473ea21d7ff
Closes-Bug: #1518889

commit_message:
Convert OVSDB APIs to commands

The correct way to send transactions to OVSDB is using
the transaction queue and not directly.
This change alters the remaining API to work like that.

Change-Id: I667cbbb6e6093a99734cde9998cf381e609d4e47

subject: Take over console session if enabled
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-11-25 09:53:43.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/conductor/manager.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/conductor/test_manager.py'], 'message': "Take over console session if enabled

Currently there's no support for taking over console session,
just leave the console_enabled status True, but no shellinabox
process running. This patch tries to start console in the new
conductor and sets console_enabled to False if failed.

Closes-Bug: #1519725
Change-Id: I62a83aa8adb8d73248e1a8dd6f840263fa60ae60
"}]
commit_message:
Take over console session if enabled

Currently there's no support for taking over console session,
just leave the console_enabled status True, but no shellinabox
process running. This patch tries to start console in the new
conductor and sets console_enabled to False if failed.

Closes-Bug: #1519725
Change-Id: I62a83aa8adb8d73248e1a8dd6f840263fa60ae60

commit_message:
Add fuel-setup-network to contrib directory

fuel-setup-network is a simple script that makes setting up networking
on master node deployed via fuel-devops easier.

It takes environment name as mandatory argument and allows to specify
environment id with -i (or --id).

Change-Id: I50fc4bb9f55baad8fc1e5606ec968ed207fb340a

subject: SwiftAPI constructor should read CONF variables at runtime
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-25 11:50:30.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/common/swift.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/common/test_swift.py'], 'message': 'SwiftAPI constructor should read CONF variables at runtime

Recently the patch Ic7865709cd87c45e6b7d49f15ce73354aa15401e
added some new imports in ironic.common.service, which caused
the following to be loaded in chain:

 ironic.api.app ->
  ironic.api.hooks ->
    ironic.conductor.rpcapi ->
      ironic.conductor.manager ->
        ironic.common.swift

Today ironic.common.swift.SwiftAPI reads value of some CONF
variables in the constructor as default arguments.  The
default values for the constructor is read at code initialization
time and same value is used subsequently on all calls. Because
the order of import was altered, code in swift.SwiftAPI was
initialized before ironic.conf was parsed in
config.parse_args (in ironic.common.service itself). The change
in this order caused all the default values to have None.

This commit stops the SwiftAPI from setting default values in
constructor method. It changes SwiftAPI.__init__() to set the
values for user, tenant from CONF at runtime if they were not
passed.

Closes-Bug: 1519774
Change-Id: I218c19dd908911140ca4640740b7dcdf2c3454ed
'}]
commit_message:
SwiftAPI constructor should read CONF variables at runtime

Recently the patch Ic7865709cd87c45e6b7d49f15ce73354aa15401e
added some new imports in ironic.common.service, which caused
the following to be loaded in chain:

 ironic.api.app ->
  ironic.api.hooks ->
    ironic.conductor.rpcapi ->
      ironic.conductor.manager ->
        ironic.common.swift

Today ironic.common.swift.SwiftAPI reads value of some CONF
variables in the constructor as default arguments.  The
default values for the constructor is read at code initialization
time and same value is used subsequently on all calls. Because
the order of import was altered, code in swift.SwiftAPI was
initialized before ironic.conf was parsed in
config.parse_args (in ironic.common.service itself). The change
in this order caused all the default values to have None.

This commit stops the SwiftAPI from setting default values in
constructor method. It changes SwiftAPI.__init__() to set the
values for user, tenant from CONF at runtime if they were not
passed.

Closes-Bug: 1519774
Change-Id: I218c19dd908911140ca4640740b7dcdf2c3454ed

commit_message:
Fix Babel polyfill location

It was moved out of app.js dependencies and made a separate
entry point - this will guarantee it will be loaded before any
other module which might use ES6-specific objects and methods.

Change-Id: I4899d53112720131cf8634d8a7f489878d096639

commit_message:
Fixed issue with cacert parameter

We need to use parameter cacert instead of ca_file parameter
to work with CA certificates like python clients for other
OpenStack services.

Also fixed typo (after copy paste from Glance code).

(cherry picked from commit 1141dd59aff141bee6618806a4496b57c214c7c1)

Change-Id: Ibe36390aab2f2edb0fe7670f76f61caeb350d34b
Closes-Bug: #1487099

commit_message:
[WIP]Adds deployment configuration methods

This patch adds a deployment configuration manager.

Available deployment parameters can be listed based on a given plan's
data. These params can be updated with new values which results in
another validation through the heat API.

In addition to this, available deployment roles can be listed.

Change-Id: I3874a952c83ba316f347351da51890ee9b7050a8

subject: Fixup neutron constraints in older overclouds before updating
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-23 13:07:16.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/yum_update.sh'], 'message': 'Fixup neutron constraints in older overclouds before updating

The neutron pcs constraints were reworked in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/229466/

For overclouds deployed with older tripleo-heat-templates the
current pcs ordering constraints will not have those changes,
meaning that the behaviour discussed at
https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1501378 is likely
given we will stop and restart all services. This review
applies those, in short, remove the ovs-cleanup after
neutron-server and add openvswitch-agent instead. Detail in
the bug report and linked BZ.

Change-Id: I45822c5fe9029f11635400b7fbd386880ac80a4e
Related-Bug: 1501378
'}]
commit_message:
Fixup neutron constraints in older overclouds before updating

The neutron pcs constraints were reworked in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/229466/

For overclouds deployed with older tripleo-heat-templates the
current pcs ordering constraints will not have those changes,
meaning that the behaviour discussed at
https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1501378 is likely
given we will stop and restart all services. This review
applies those, in short, remove the ovs-cleanup after
neutron-server and add openvswitch-agent instead. Detail in
the bug report and linked BZ.

Change-Id: I45822c5fe9029f11635400b7fbd386880ac80a4e
Related-Bug: 1501378

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-11-23 11:40:59.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/controller/dhcp_app.py', 'dragonflow/db/db_store.py'], 'message': 'Add support for unicast DHCP requests

DHCP client will start sending unicast messages by the Renewal
Time Value (T1), and unicast and broadcast from Rebinding
Time Value (T2). By default this values are 50 percent of the
lease time for T1 and 87.5 percent for T2

Currently we do not set this values in our SDN based DHCP server
and we let the client use its defaults.

Change-Id: Ie77dba7be9182de5a9e44eed9cec0a58c66cef82
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for unicast DHCP requests

DHCP client will start sending unicast messages by the Renewal
Time Value (T1), and unicast and broadcast from Rebinding
Time Value (T2). By default this values are 50 percent of the
lease time for T1 and 87.5 percent for T2

Currently we do not set this values in our SDN based DHCP server
and we let the client use its defaults.

Change-Id: Ie77dba7be9182de5a9e44eed9cec0a58c66cef82

commit_message:
Use consistent argument names for find proxies

A grep of the argument names for find proxies showed 60 using the
`name_or_id` positional argument and 5 using `value`. This change brings
them all in line to be the same, `name_or_id`.

Change-Id: Ide2a1b2e201bf1b0a712464e9c1d77f2214ccfc8

commit_message:
Cleanup doc references to past modules

As we've recently moved to KSA, there are several remaining references
to things like our old transport code as well as the included auth
plugin code. In order to have the docs building cleanly, this change
removes anything that no longer exists. A separate change can properly
document anything necessary to add.

subject: bagpipe: port delete action on BEFORE_DELETE event
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-11-25 13:56:58.000000000', 'files': ['networking_bgpvpn/neutron/db/bgpvpn_db.py', 'networking_bgpvpn/tests/unit/services/test_plugin.py', 'networking_bgpvpn/tests/unit/services/bagpipe/test_bagpipe.py', 'networking_bgpvpn/neutron/services/service_drivers/bagpipe/bagpipe.py'], 'message': "bagpipe: port delete action on BEFORE_DELETE event

Details on the issue in bug #1517480.

We need to subscribe to port before_delete events, because
on after_delete events the port is already removed from the db
and we can't retrieve the binding:host_id information (which
is not passed in the event either).

This change also include a unit test against this bug, which also
happens to go through the ML2 RPC-to-registry codepaths so that
the effect of real registry events against our code are tested, thus
testing the validity of the expectation that the bagpipe driver code
has against ML2. This addresses bug #1493901.

One test is not passing, and thus commented out: see bug 1519258.

Closes-Bug: 1517480
Closes-Bug: 1493901

Change-Id: Icce89d98bcc4424529dcbe661fed3c1c8191418c
"}]
commit_message:
bagpipe: port delete action on BEFORE_DELETE event

Details on the issue in bug #1517480.

We need to subscribe to port before_delete events, because
on after_delete events the port is already removed from the db
and we can't retrieve the binding:host_id information (which
is not passed in the event either).

This change also include a unit test against this bug, which also
happens to go through the ML2 RPC-to-registry codepaths so that
the effect of real registry events against our code are tested, thus
testing the validity of the expectation that the bagpipe driver code
has against ML2. This addresses bug #1493901.

One test is not passing, and thus commented out: see bug 1519258.

Closes-Bug: 1517480
Closes-Bug: 1493901

Change-Id: Icce89d98bcc4424529dcbe661fed3c1c8191418c

commit_message:
Unblocks Gate-Use oslo_middleware

In recent release of oslo.middleware
(https://launchpad.net/oslo.middleware/+milestone/3.0.0)
removed the usage of oslo namespace, hence causing 
gating errors as we still have one reference to
oslo.middleware. This commit fixes the same.

UpgradeImpact
Change-Id: I6bb68c22dffc370a9745538d4d26db5137f29a7e

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-25 00:18:50.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/policies/blueprints.rst'], 'message': "Clarify how we milestones are assigned

Milestone assignment is another mumbo jumbo effort in open source.
Artificially setting milestones implies that someone can reliably
predict the future when no-one is really in full control.

For this reason let's make clear that we optmistically target the
current milestone for work that is supposed to start asap, and
complete sooner rather than later. Rolling over until the work is
complete is the natural course of action.

Dashboards [1] then capture the entire workload (BP and RFE) for
the entire release cycle, and that's helpful to provide to overall
view.

[1] https://launchpad.net/neutron/+milestone/<release>-?

Change-Id: Idb2d84ba683d2c8f1460e7bf0ff76d457cf42bce
"}]
commit_message:
Clarify how we milestones are assigned

Milestone assignment is another mumbo jumbo effort in open source.
Artificially setting milestones implies that someone can reliably
predict the future when no-one is really in full control.

For this reason let's make clear that we optmistically target the
current milestone for work that is supposed to start asap, and
complete sooner rather than later. Rolling over until the work is
complete is the natural course of action.

Dashboards [1] then capture the entire workload (BP and RFE) for
the entire release cycle, and that's helpful to provide to overall
view.

[1] https://launchpad.net/neutron/+milestone/<release>-?

Change-Id: Idb2d84ba683d2c8f1460e7bf0ff76d457cf42bce

commit_message:
Set DIB_INSTALLTYPE_puppet_modules for master/stable

Currently we override in CI so we install puppet modules from source
for master, meaning that using tripleo.sh without manually overriding
the DIB_INSTALLTYPE doesn't work (the pinned modules are too old).

Conversely, for stable/liberty, we want to use the stable packaged
version as building from-master modules won't work.

Change-Id: I07f3bf081feb4a2dad649600cd67a5c80f6a04a9
(cherry picked from commit f1eea658aa08a0c4348cc0f8a9e3faed766cb662)

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-19 08:44:11.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_convg_stack.py', 'heat/engine/stack.py'], 'message': 'Convergence: Fix duplicate events for stack actions

When stack actions such as suspend/resume/snapshot/restore are
completed, two events are logged in DB.

The above stack actions still use stack lock even under convergence.
Hence when setting the stack action as complete/failed, state_set
should not persist state.
Sending notification, events and saving Complete/Failed state in DB
is done at the time of releasing lock for these stack actions.

Change-Id: Ib3e6c1de2f2f17502049e06ae484cb2e50867fab
Closes-Bug: #1516089
'}]
commit_message:
Convergence: Fix duplicate events for stack actions

When stack actions such as suspend/resume/snapshot/restore are
completed, two events are logged in DB.

The above stack actions still use stack lock even under convergence.
Hence when setting the stack action as complete/failed, state_set
should not persist state.
Sending notification, events and saving Complete/Failed state in DB
is done at the time of releasing lock for these stack actions.

Change-Id: Ib3e6c1de2f2f17502049e06ae484cb2e50867fab
Closes-Bug: #1516089

commit_message:
Enable PhantomJS for running Selenium tests

This patch enables the PhantomJS webdriver for running
the Selenium test suite.

Use it with the --selenium-phantomjs command-line switch
when executing the selenium and integration suite.

Blueprint: enable-phantomjs-selenium

commit_message:
don't pass ceilometer options to oslo.db engine facade

oslo.db EngineFacade class only support options defined by oslo.db,
but we're passing options defined by ceilometer, so oslo.db complains
with a warning message:

NotSupportedWarning: Configuration option(s) ['alarm_connection', \
'alarm_history_time_to_live', 'db2nosql_resource_id_maxlen', \
'event_connection', 'event_time_to_live', 'metering_connection', \
'metering_time_to_live'] not supported exception.NotSupportedWarning

This patch makes sure only options defined by oslo.db will be sent
to EngineFacade

Change-Id: I2a39737a5f7824918c28ff2180f2ea95e7e82537
Closes-Bug: #1516515

subject: Fix method retrieving error codes from HRESULTs
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-23 10:37:19.000000000', 'files': ['os_win/utils/win32utils.py'], 'message': 'Fix method retrieving error codes from HRESULTs

The win32utils method retrieving error codes from HRESULTS
incorrectly fetches only the last HRESULT byte. Instead, it
should retrieve the last 2 bytes, otherwise returning
wrong error results for error codes greater than 255.

This patch fixes this issue.

Change-Id: I43a7ef2ce44e454e395b65dfb41246d79a8f3587
'}]
commit_message:
Fix method retrieving error codes from HRESULTs

The win32utils method retrieving error codes from HRESULTS
incorrectly fetches only the last HRESULT byte. Instead, it
should retrieve the last 2 bytes, otherwise returning
wrong error results for error codes greater than 255.

This patch fixes this issue.

Change-Id: I43a7ef2ce44e454e395b65dfb41246d79a8f3587

commit_message:
Add retry decorator to the add_multiple_virt_features method

Adding virtual resources was consistently failing on our CIs,
especially when attaching the configdrive.

This patch attempts to fix this by adding the same decorator
that was used for the modify_virt_resource method, which had
avoided similar issues.

Change-Id: Ic9c8ffe1e1e33faf9037818ded1ddc3caf6d0aba

commit_message:
Set auth_plugin type to password when building sdk connection

Before the following change[1] being added into formal release of
openstacksdk, user needs to specify auth_plugin type explicitly
when building sdk connection. This patch revises creation_connection
method in senlin sdk driver to make it work.

[1]https://review.openstack.org/248929

Change-Id: I7cf1bfcd5047af80ff0b0843058be55dac7d7dc9
Closes-Bug: #1519684

subject: Speedup gathering pids from namespaces by OCF
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 8786, 'name': 'Vladimir Kuklin', 'email': 'aglarendil@gmail.com', 'username': 'aglarendil'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11090, 'name': 'Sergii Golovatiuk', 'email': 'sgolovat@redhat.com', 'username': 'holser'}, {'_account_id': 11827, 'name': 'Stanislaw Bogatkin', 'email': 'regs+ubuntu.com@sbog.ru', 'username': 'sbogatkin'}, {'_account_id': 13343, 'name': 'Stanislav Makar', 'email': 'stas.makar@gmail.com', 'username': 'smakar'}, {'_account_id': 14610, 'name': 'Denis V. Meltsaykin', 'email': 'dmeltsaykin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'dmeltsaykin'}, {'_account_id': 14689, 'name': 'Vitaly Sedelnik', 'email': 'vitaly.sedelnik@canonical.com', 'username': 'vsedelnik'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-25 11:56:57.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/cluster/files/ocf/neutron-agent-l3', 'deployment/puppet/cluster/files/ocf/neutron-agent-dhcp'], 'message': 'Speedup gathering pids from namespaces by OCF

Currently, neutron OCF scripts are using `lsof` to gather pids of
processes running in particular namespace. `lsof` is extremely slow
due to inoptimal architecture and causes significant timeouts:
2+ minutes on 300 pids in 300 namespaces. On the other hand,
we cannot use `ip netns pids`, as this command is not present in
precise. The fix changes this call to the 2-stage execution inspired
by the original code of `ip netns pids`, which uses comparison of
the namespace inode with the `ns/net` symlink of the running
process that points to the required namespace. This scales about
linear: 1.7 seconds per 300 pids in 300 namespaces.

Closes-Bug: #1464815
Closes-Bug: #1405477

Change-Id: Ife3f5da3558bf4b5ddd0abbe997cd4b845a8d53c
'}]
commit_message:
Speedup gathering pids from namespaces by OCF

Currently, neutron OCF scripts are using `lsof` to gather pids of
processes running in particular namespace. `lsof` is extremely slow
due to inoptimal architecture and causes significant timeouts:
2+ minutes on 300 pids in 300 namespaces. On the other hand,
we cannot use `ip netns pids`, as this command is not present in
precise. The fix changes this call to the 2-stage execution inspired
by the original code of `ip netns pids`, which uses comparison of
the namespace inode with the `ns/net` symlink of the running
process that points to the required namespace. This scales about
linear: 1.7 seconds per 300 pids in 300 namespaces.

Closes-Bug: #1464815
Closes-Bug: #1405477

Change-Id: Ife3f5da3558bf4b5ddd0abbe997cd4b845a8d53c

revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2015-11-23 14:55:22.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/image/image_utils.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_image_utils.py'], 'message': "Fix the bug of OSError when convert image

When I try to convert a image use image_utils.convert_image() method,
an error occurred like this :
'''
OSError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory:
'sheepdog:10.133.17.61:7000:volume-a0a70f9b-a50e-4369-885f-c41a894c9fe5'
'''
The reason is that in some cluster storage systems, like
ceph/sheepdog, QEMU can access an image directly via their private
protocol, and there’s no need to map an image as a block device on
the host. In this case, the qemu-img convert command may like:

    #qemu-img convert -O raw sheepdog:Ip:port:image_name temp_file
    #qemu-img convert -O raw rbd:pool_name/image_name temp_file

The source path may be 'sheepdog:Ip:port:image_name' or
'rbd:pool_name/image_name', it doesn't exist in OS. So, when it runs
the os.stat(source) in image_utils.convert_image(source,dest,out_format)
method, an OSError would be raised.

We can use qemu_img_info method instead to resolve this problem, because
the 'qemu-img info' command can always get the image size info which has
support qemu-img tool. Here we capture a ValueError just in case, but it
only need to give a warning message, because the image has been successfully
converted.

Change-Id: I5fd1e51840972a67053b85a76f8e001fa8148ad7
Closes-Bug: #1514442
"}]
commit_message:
Fix the bug of OSError when convert image

When I try to convert a image use image_utils.convert_image() method,
an error occurred like this :
'''
OSError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory:
'sheepdog:10.133.17.61:7000:volume-a0a70f9b-a50e-4369-885f-c41a894c9fe5'
'''
The reason is that in some cluster storage systems, like
ceph/sheepdog, QEMU can access an image directly via their private
protocol, and there’s no need to map an image as a block device on
the host. In this case, the qemu-img convert command may like:

    #qemu-img convert -O raw sheepdog:Ip:port:image_name temp_file
    #qemu-img convert -O raw rbd:pool_name/image_name temp_file

The source path may be 'sheepdog:Ip:port:image_name' or
'rbd:pool_name/image_name', it doesn't exist in OS. So, when it runs
the os.stat(source) in image_utils.convert_image(source,dest,out_format)
method, an OSError would be raised.

We can use qemu_img_info method instead to resolve this problem, because
the 'qemu-img info' command can always get the image size info which has
support qemu-img tool. Here we capture a ValueError just in case, but it
only need to give a warning message, because the image has been successfully
converted.

Change-Id: I5fd1e51840972a67053b85a76f8e001fa8148ad7
Closes-Bug: #1514442

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-11-25 12:23:16.000000000', 'files': ['fuel-bootstrap-image-builder/bin/fuel-bootstrap-image'], 'message': 'Fix PATH variable for Ubuntu based bootstrap

CentOS 7 has $PATH variable which is different from Ubuntu one.
In particular, CentOS does not export /sbin or /bin. This leads
to inability to find basic commands like rm, ln or MAKEDEV
(even though they are present in environment) when executing
simple chroot() from CentOS to Ubuntu-based environment.

Blueprint: master-on-centos7

Compatible with CentOS6 master node

Change-Id: I2ce18598bcd84a328b149a135ed8579ffb8b5200'}]
commit_message:
Fix PATH variable for Ubuntu based bootstrap

CentOS 7 has $PATH variable which is different from Ubuntu one.
In particular, CentOS does not export /sbin or /bin. This leads
to inability to find basic commands like rm, ln or MAKEDEV
(even though they are present in environment) when executing
simple chroot() from CentOS to Ubuntu-based environment.

Blueprint: master-on-centos7

Compatible with CentOS6 master node

Change-Id: I2ce18598bcd84a328b149a135ed8579ffb8b5200

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-13 20:13:58.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'net-bgpvpn: Make requirements check non-voting

Until we make a first release, our current master targets stable/liberty.
Currently, the check-requirements jobs currently prevent us from updating
our *requirements.txt file with liberty-compatible versions.

We also plan to have backport branches for kilo and juno, but if
check-requirements jobs have no way to determine that these branches
ought to be tested against the stable/kilo and stable/juno requirements,
we expect the same issue.

This change makes check-requirements non-voting.

Change-Id: I21c8aadd82249882243bf8e23b37e23fcb62f507
'}]
commit_message:
net-bgpvpn: Make requirements check non-voting

Until we make a first release, our current master targets stable/liberty.
Currently, the check-requirements jobs currently prevent us from updating
our *requirements.txt file with liberty-compatible versions.

We also plan to have backport branches for kilo and juno, but if
check-requirements jobs have no way to determine that these branches
ought to be tested against the stable/kilo and stable/juno requirements,
we expect the same issue.

This change makes check-requirements non-voting.

Change-Id: I21c8aadd82249882243bf8e23b37e23fcb62f507

subject: Check response headers for microversions
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-11-23 18:13:21.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/tests/unit/test_api_versions.py', 'novaclient/api_versions.py', 'novaclient/client.py'], 'message': 'Check response headers for microversions

novaclient provides version negotiation on CLI layer. In case of usage
novaclient as a lib, user can specify api_version with microversion part
and can try communicate with Nova endpoint which doesn't support
microversions. Nova endpoint will not check X-OpenStack-Nova-API-Version
header and will execute request(it can be correct or not). It this case
we should warn user about his mistake and about "incorrect" response.

Change-Id: I7a5ab964b7b2b2a49cc80c22bf67ad5548afb30b
'}]
commit_message:
Check response headers for microversions

novaclient provides version negotiation on CLI layer. In case of usage
novaclient as a lib, user can specify api_version with microversion part
and can try communicate with Nova endpoint which doesn't support
microversions. Nova endpoint will not check X-OpenStack-Nova-API-Version
header and will execute request(it can be correct or not). It this case
we should warn user about his mistake and about "incorrect" response.

Change-Id: I7a5ab964b7b2b2a49cc80c22bf67ad5548afb30b

commit_message:
Rename default config

The default config file for searchlight is searchlight-api.conf despite
the fact it's used by the listener as well. It makes more sense to
rename the default to searchlight.conf.

Change-Id: I91744f02a27faa00f5ce082557cf78bf911fb085
Closes-bug: #1515015

subject: Add ipaddress to global-requirements.txt
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-25 12:36:18.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Add ipaddress to global-requirements.txt

Port of the 3.3+ ipaddress module to 2.6, 2.7, 3.2

- Is the library actively maintained?

  Yes. See the recent commit history at:
  https://github.com/phihag/ipaddress/commits/master

- Is the library good code?

  Yes, given it's a port of a Python 3.3 module.

- Is the library python 3 compatible?

  Yes.

- Is the library license compatible?

  The license is Python Software Foundation License Version 2:
  https://github.com/phihag/ipaddress/blob/master/LICENSE

- Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu
  latest / Fedora latest)?

  Yes, it's packaged for Ubuntu, Fedora, CentOS.

- Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
  in ``global-requirements.txt``?

  Not that I'm aware of.

Change-Id: Ic4ba8e767369a68f1ac9379dc71ec01b2967c6ce
"}]
commit_message:
Add ipaddress to global-requirements.txt

Port of the 3.3+ ipaddress module to 2.6, 2.7, 3.2

- Is the library actively maintained?

  Yes. See the recent commit history at:
  https://github.com/phihag/ipaddress/commits/master

- Is the library good code?

  Yes, given it's a port of a Python 3.3 module.

- Is the library python 3 compatible?

  Yes.

- Is the library license compatible?

  The license is Python Software Foundation License Version 2:
  https://github.com/phihag/ipaddress/blob/master/LICENSE

- Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu
  latest / Fedora latest)?

  Yes, it's packaged for Ubuntu, Fedora, CentOS.

- Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
  in ``global-requirements.txt``?

  Not that I'm aware of.

Change-Id: Ic4ba8e767369a68f1ac9379dc71ec01b2967c6ce

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-23 14:06:28.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Don't build two tox envs for pep8(-constraints)

Currently, "tox -e pep8" builds two tox envs:
a "pep8" env, and then a "venv" env for genopts.

This is rather wasteful -- reuse the pep8 env
instead.

Change-Id: I8ba3d4e541f279e5bc62dba2b1caaac447fee7e3
'}]
commit_message:
Don't build two tox envs for pep8(-constraints)

Currently, "tox -e pep8" builds two tox envs:
a "pep8" env, and then a "venv" env for genopts.

This is rather wasteful -- reuse the pep8 env
instead.

Change-Id: I8ba3d4e541f279e5bc62dba2b1caaac447fee7e3

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-24 19:20:04.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Add check-requirements for cliff

cliff had made requirements check in
I40b2cf4030df66c851d7d11da4f81f645d110e76 and it was not enabled again.

Remove non-voting and make it voting in the gate as well - with using
the check-requirements template.

Note that cliff is in the global requirments sync, thus it should have a
gate job as explained in
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/requirements/#enforcement-in-projects

Change-Id: I4f22c58e469d42b64694123b13c64fe620bae1eb
'}]
commit_message:
Add check-requirements for cliff

cliff had made requirements check in
I40b2cf4030df66c851d7d11da4f81f645d110e76 and it was not enabled again.

Remove non-voting and make it voting in the gate as well - with using
the check-requirements template.

Note that cliff is in the global requirments sync, thus it should have a
gate job as explained in
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/requirements/#enforcement-in-projects

Change-Id: I4f22c58e469d42b64694123b13c64fe620bae1eb

subject: Add "httpchk /versions" for glance-api haproxy.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-23 13:11:55.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/vars/configs/haproxy_config.yml'], 'message': 'Add "httpchk /versions" for glance-api haproxy.

With the default httpchk, glance-api always show warning in the logs
"WARNING glance.api.middleware.version_negotiation [..] Unknown version.
Returning version choices", with the /versions added, there is no
warning in the log.

Change-Id: I086cb23c30b9e3ddc5eac68cba42d03ed907138c
(cherry picked from commit 2a2da2f5aa271eebb06016060c62eee4618a0228)
'}]
commit_message:
Add "httpchk /versions" for glance-api haproxy.

With the default httpchk, glance-api always show warning in the logs
"WARNING glance.api.middleware.version_negotiation [..] Unknown version.
Returning version choices", with the /versions added, there is no
warning in the log.

Change-Id: I086cb23c30b9e3ddc5eac68cba42d03ed907138c
(cherry picked from commit 2a2da2f5aa271eebb06016060c62eee4618a0228)

commit_message:
[config-ref] Dummy include of conf-change tables

This patch includes most of the conf-changes tables in chapters to make
the build work without too much tweaks in conf.py.

Also manually fix a broken cinder table.

Change-Id: I9f77926bcd1f9688ae877951bd969ac5fcd29b61
Implements: blueprint config-ref-rst

commit_message:
Update juno for new dev work - 20 Nov 2015

Updates all repo SHAs to open up work on 10.1.18

The SHA's included in this patch are very likely to be the final SHA's
for Juno as the EOL for Juno in OpenStack is scheduled for today.

Closes-Bug: #1515001
Change-Id: Ieac6696abca78daa2b1fa377a680a86fff9a1d24

commit_message:
Add support of extend_kopts for ubuntu_bootstrap

This commit adds posibility to use different kernel boot options
if user would like to modify it. The extend_kopts.rb takes two strings,
compares them and modifies default kopts.

Implements: Blueprint modify-fuel-library
Change-Id: Iac69c8457bd0ce76a1082c98d679ff44f468bf1f

commit_message:
Modifying docimpact group

Modfying the default docimpact group for all projects (except Nova, Swift,
Glance, Keystone, and Cinder) to raise bugs in their own projects, rather
than openstack-manuals.

Change-Id: Ide50b2fcbb070943d2b7efed728c40383a05aed9
Implements-blueprint: review-docimpact

subject: [zmq] Use PortOpt config option for ports
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-11-20 19:46:16.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_zmq.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/zmq_driver/matchmaker/matchmaker_redis.py'], 'message': '[zmq] Use PortOpt config option for ports

Use PortOpt instead of IntOpt for port-range restriction
options (rpc_zmq_min_port, rpc_zmq_max_port) and other
port-related options.

Change-Id: I7442de45e57713cdfa332cd897a07fb11926ca49
Closes-Bug: #1518256
'}]
commit_message:
[zmq] Use PortOpt config option for ports

Use PortOpt instead of IntOpt for port-range restriction
options (rpc_zmq_min_port, rpc_zmq_max_port) and other
port-related options.

Change-Id: I7442de45e57713cdfa332cd897a07fb11926ca49

Error message changed when Update environment returns HTTP 400
at commit ac2b523302604abca83212233d5d68ea43651877.

        characters, must start with alpha

commit_message:
[docs] Update error message

Error message changed when Update environment returns HTTP 400
at commit ac2b523302604abca83212233d5d68ea43651877.

before: Environment name must contain only alphanumeric or "_-."
        characters, must start with alpha
after : Environment name must contain at least one non-white
        space symbol

This patch fixes it in the doc.

Change-Id: I9bba2cb92cf8d034c54a6209a8ba60b3075b15db
Closes-Bug: #1519217

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-11 22:17:46.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/tempest-dsvm-cells-rc'], 'message': "cells: skip 5 networking scenario tests that use floating IPs

These scenario tests run with neutron and rely on assigning floating IPs
which cells v1 doesn't support, so skip them.

Longer term I think we'll have a feature toggle in Tempest to allow
disabling these tests via config but this is quicker and easier for now
to get a cells v1 + neutron job in the experimental queue.

Change-Id: Ieb3b117449f56810f1a41fcf43e737ae919b8945
"}]
commit_message:
cells: skip 5 networking scenario tests that use floating IPs

These scenario tests run with neutron and rely on assigning floating IPs
which cells v1 doesn't support, so skip them.

Longer term I think we'll have a feature toggle in Tempest to allow
disabling these tests via config but this is quicker and easier for now
to get a cells v1 + neutron job in the experimental queue.

Change-Id: Ieb3b117449f56810f1a41fcf43e737ae919b8945

commit_message:
Bug fix while editing actions with missing keys

If a key is not present in the database, the panel failed to open the modal
windows for edition, this fix that by using the dict.get()

cherry-picked from: b08558eba43dfc45335ad817de327048ad76cf64

Change-Id: Ic5f5e216828f10d41f288408fc5109dc004c6ab9

commit_message:
Freezer Scheduler for Windows

Freezer now has support for scheduling jobs through windows service.

This windows service needs to be installed in user land rather than
service land, instructions are included in the README.rst

--no-api mode is not available on windows

Change-Id: I34db28ffc928703b01e6430a661214d66d81c518

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-25 09:39:29.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Disable mistral-python34 in all branches except mitaka and higher

Support of python34 was implemented only in mitaka, so it was
incorrect to make this gate voting in all branches because now
merge patches in old stable branches is blocked.

Change-Id: I8772b59bd3b318f3c1caec6cc8a27a33af6bbf87
'}]
commit_message:
Disable mistral-python34 in all branches except mitaka and higher

Support of python34 was implemented only in mitaka, so it was
incorrect to make this gate voting in all branches because now
merge patches in old stable branches is blocked.

Change-Id: I8772b59bd3b318f3c1caec6cc8a27a33af6bbf87

Add guidelines for release notes to devref

Starting from this cycle (and stable Liberty) we're using reno for
release notes. This commit adds guidelines on when a release note is
required to be added.

commit_message:
Change cluster to cluster_id in nodegroup

Introduced by change-id: I413f77ce1dca59ae2c48ba743513ddf5584713e8
Nodegroup 'cluster' field has been changed to 'cluster_id' in
nailgun. So we need to adjust fuelclient accordingly.

Also includes some changes in nodegroups unit tests.

Change-Id: Iba3df02142279c14910578770187ac93157190c4
Closes-bug: #1518341

commit_message:
Implement Gnocchi Statsd support

* Manage Gnocchi statsd package & service
* Manage Gnocchi configuration
* Complete example manifests and acceptance tests with the new class.
* Make sure db_sync is run before gnocchi services, otherwise statsd
  would fail to start.

Change-Id: Ib894571889a69e67760402217f9fc18a339ced19

commit_message:
Add display_name to Quobyte backend volume name

Improves readability in Quobyte volume names by
using display_name and id to build the backend volume name.
The share display name is preserved to keep volume names easily
identifyable in the backend.
Adding the share id ensures uniqueness of
Quobyte backend volume names.

Implements: blueprint display-name-in-quobyte-backend

Change-Id: Ie7ffd3d45aa258bde3845547055ff3e85fffb8db

subject: Move Calico's mechanism driver to networking-calico
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-11-25 10:40:43.000000000', 'files': ['debian/changelog', 'test-requirements.txt', 'networking_calico/plugins/ml2/__init__.py', 'networking_calico/plugins/ml2/drivers/calico/test/test_plugin_etcd.py', 'requirements.txt', 'debian/calico-compute.install', 'networking_calico/plugins/ml2/drivers/calico/test/__init__.py', 'debian/calico-compute.postinst', 'debian/source/format', 'rpm/networking-calico.spec', 'networking_calico/plugins/ml2/drivers/calico/t_etcd.py', 'debian/networking-calico.install', '.coveragerc', 'networking_calico/plugins/ml2/drivers/__init__.py', 'networking_calico/plugins/ml2/drivers/calico/test/stub_etcd.py', 'debian/rules', 'networking_calico/plugins/ml2/drivers/calico/mech_calico.py', 'debian/calico-control.install', 'debian/copyright', 'networking_calico/plugins/__init__.py', 'debian/control', 'networking_calico/plugins/ml2/drivers/calico/__init__.py', 'networking_calico/plugins/ml2/drivers/calico/election.py', 'networking_calico/plugins/ml2/drivers/calico/test/lib.py', 'networking_calico/plugins/ml2/drivers/calico/test/test_election.py', 'debian/compat', 'setup.cfg', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Move Calico's mechanism driver to networking-calico

The Calico mechanism driver was previously part of
https://github.com/projectcalico/calico, but logically belongs in
networking-calico - the OpenStack/Neutron integration code for Calico
- and so is now moving to this repository.  As well as the mechanism
driver code, this move includes:

- unit testing for the mechanism driver

- creation of a neutron.ml2.mechanism_drivers entry point for the name
  'calico'

- requirements updates as needed for the new code.

Also, so that Calico's Debian and RPM package-based installations
continue to work, and so that existing installations can be smoothly
upgraded, this change adds Debian and RPM packaging to
networking-calico.  Established Calico installation instructions [1,2]
use the umbrella package names 'calico-control' and 'calico-compute'
to indicate whatever is needed to add Calico function to an OpenStack
controller and compute node respectively, and (as these are
OpenStack-specific concepts) responsibility for generating these
umbrella packages also now moves from
https://github.com/projectcalico/calico to networking-calico.

calico-control and calico-compute both depend on a third package,
'networking-calico', which is the package that contains
networking-calico's Python code.  Thus an install of the
'networking-calico' Debian or RPM package should be very similar to a
'pip install networking-calico' from PyPI.

[1] http://docs.projectcalico.org/en/latest/ubuntu-opens-install.html
[2] http://docs.projectcalico.org/en/latest/redhat-opens-install.html

Change-Id: I54724a4e4fbb465daddcff07e6da19cb91b2dc4a
"}]
commit_message:
Move Calico's mechanism driver to networking-calico

The Calico mechanism driver was previously part of
https://github.com/projectcalico/calico, but logically belongs in
networking-calico - the OpenStack/Neutron integration code for Calico
- and so is now moving to this repository.  As well as the mechanism
driver code, this move includes:

- unit testing for the mechanism driver

- creation of a neutron.ml2.mechanism_drivers entry point for the name
  'calico'

- requirements updates as needed for the new code.

Also, so that Calico's Debian and RPM package-based installations
continue to work, and so that existing installations can be smoothly
upgraded, this change adds Debian and RPM packaging to
networking-calico.  Established Calico installation instructions [1,2]
use the umbrella package names 'calico-control' and 'calico-compute'
to indicate whatever is needed to add Calico function to an OpenStack
controller and compute node respectively, and (as these are
OpenStack-specific concepts) responsibility for generating these
umbrella packages also now moves from
https://github.com/projectcalico/calico to networking-calico.

calico-control and calico-compute both depend on a third package,
'networking-calico', which is the package that contains
networking-calico's Python code.  Thus an install of the
'networking-calico' Debian or RPM package should be very similar to a
'pip install networking-calico' from PyPI.

[1] http://docs.projectcalico.org/en/latest/ubuntu-opens-install.html
[2] http://docs.projectcalico.org/en/latest/redhat-opens-install.html

Change-Id: I54724a4e4fbb465daddcff07e6da19cb91b2dc4a

from the Neutron tree. The code is maintained at github repository.

subject: Fix two errors in setup_training_guides
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-24 08:06:58.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/common_translation_update.sh'], 'message': "Fix two errors in setup_training_guides

setup_training_guides was written assuming that the project would be
passed as the first argument, but it wasn't called like that. Change
the function to match others to hardcode the project, and look for the
version as the first argument.

Correct the path to the locale directory so that the Zanata client can
read and write translation files correctly.

Change-Id: Iacfd2e831d18af5870fc70a2a54e569d0924474e
"}]
commit_message:
Fix two errors in setup_training_guides

setup_training_guides was written assuming that the project would be
passed as the first argument, but it wasn't called like that. Change
the function to match others to hardcode the project, and look for the
version as the first argument.

Correct the path to the locale directory so that the Zanata client can
read and write translation files correctly.

Change-Id: Iacfd2e831d18af5870fc70a2a54e569d0924474e

commit_message:
Skip cinder tests if cinder is not available

Currently, cinder tests run even when the cinder service is not
available and fails. This commit skips the tests if the cinder
service is not available.

This patch also updates readme on using tox to run tempest tests.

Change-Id: Idd607012346004b39c9d4cbe752b0cdcfe3e3311

commit_message:
New operation env-template-create-env

After create a new template you need to create the environment from template.
You need a operation for this action. This is the new operation.

Implements blueprint: template-create-environment

revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2015-11-13 02:40:53.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/deploy/install-guide.rst'], 'message': 'refine the ironic installation guide

From the Juno version, we have the OpenStackClient to identify
the component. So we can substitute OpenStackClient for keystone
to identify the ironic.
I checked the OpenStackClient commands guide:
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/OpenStackClient/Commands#endpoint
The OpenStackClient API version is:API v2.0
The OpenStackClient command is:
os endpoint create
    --publicurl <public-url>
    [--adminurl <admin-url>]
    [--internalurl <internal-url>]
    [--region <endpoint-region>]
    <service>
And the keystone command is:
keystone endpoint-create
    [--region <endpoint-region>]
    [--service_id <service-id>]
    [--publicurl <public-url>]
    [--adminurl <admin-url>]
    [--internalurl <internal-url>]
Change-Id: I51ced0aeb04aed486cbe644305a9c19233e1d398
'}]
commit_message:
refine the ironic installation guide

From the Juno version, we have the OpenStackClient to identify
the component. So we can substitute OpenStackClient for keystone
to identify the ironic.
I checked the OpenStackClient commands guide:
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/OpenStackClient/Commands#endpoint
The OpenStackClient API version is:API v2.0
The OpenStackClient command is:
os endpoint create
    --publicurl <public-url>
    [--adminurl <admin-url>]
    [--internalurl <internal-url>]
    [--region <endpoint-region>]
    <service>
And the keystone command is:
keystone endpoint-create
    [--region <endpoint-region>]
    [--service_id <service-id>]
    [--publicurl <public-url>]
    [--adminurl <admin-url>]
    [--internalurl <internal-url>]
Change-Id: I51ced0aeb04aed486cbe644305a9c19233e1d398

subject: Use paramiko transport for gate check jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-11-23 21:16:42.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/gate-check-commit.sh'], 'message': "Use paramiko transport for gate check jobs

There have been a lot of random ssh connection errors in the gate jobs lately
where the ssh connection itself is successful, but then no data can be sent
over the open connection. Ansible usually throws an error like this:

    SSH Error: data could not be sent to the remote host. Make sure this host
    can be reached over ssh

After digging in Ansible's code, this occurs when the ssh connection is open,
but no data can be written to the ssh connection. Ansible developers are
switching the default transport to paramiko for some modern operating systems
(like OS X El Capitan) due to some reliability issues with the ssh client.

Change-Id: Ia2e76a12e8b06dce448ed7e122b60386f5856d50
"}]
commit_message:
Use paramiko transport for gate check jobs

There have been a lot of random ssh connection errors in the gate jobs lately
where the ssh connection itself is successful, but then no data can be sent
over the open connection. Ansible usually throws an error like this:

    SSH Error: data could not be sent to the remote host. Make sure this host
    can be reached over ssh

After digging in Ansible's code, this occurs when the ssh connection is open,
but no data can be written to the ssh connection. Ansible developers are
switching the default transport to paramiko for some modern operating systems
(like OS X El Capitan) due to some reliability issues with the ssh client.

Change-Id: Ia2e76a12e8b06dce448ed7e122b60386f5856d50

subject: Disable ssh pipelining for gate check jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-23 14:57:39.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/gate-check-commit.sh'], 'message': "Disable ssh pipelining for gate check jobs

There have been a lot of random ssh connection errors in the gate jobs lately
where the ssh connection itself is successful, but then no data can be sent
over the open connection. Ansible usually throws an error like this:

    SSH Error: data could not be sent to the remote host. Make sure this host
    can be reached over ssh

After digging in Ansible's code, this occurs when the ssh connection is open,
but no data can be written to the ssh connection.

In order to work around this issue until Ansible 2 is released, SSH Pipelining
is being disabled.

Change-Id: Id68b3dd22cc3c57ab49822635bb9bee2370f0aef
"}]
commit_message:
Disable ssh pipelining for gate check jobs

There have been a lot of random ssh connection errors in the gate jobs lately
where the ssh connection itself is successful, but then no data can be sent
over the open connection. Ansible usually throws an error like this:

    SSH Error: data could not be sent to the remote host. Make sure this host
    can be reached over ssh

After digging in Ansible's code, this occurs when the ssh connection is open,
but no data can be written to the ssh connection.

In order to work around this issue until Ansible 2 is released, SSH Pipelining
is being disabled.

Change-Id: Id68b3dd22cc3c57ab49822635bb9bee2370f0aef

commit_message:
Convert gate to Ansible setup

To support multinode we must now distribute our setup to multiple
hosts. Instead of making special rules for this, we are going to
convert our existing setup to Ansible. This way both setup proceedures
take place in the exact same fashion.

Partially-Implements: blueprint multinode-gate
Change-Id: I43ece298bba994e9b5083403ef3cf6d4245cda6d
(cherry picked from commit f9ee96f21695f7eba81c07e257eda3a080108b70)

commit_message:
Add provision and deprovision test for cfapi

- Add Mock app which will be imported during the test run.
This app will be deployed through Cloudfoundry API Murano Service
Broker.
- Change plugin to make possible create a zip archive
in murano_tempest_tests directory.
- Add application_catalog client into services directory to
perform operations with packages.
- Add utils to make possible dummy app generation.
- Add functions to provide additional functionality to
service_broker client.
- Add functions to service_broker base to make cleanups easier.
- Add provision and deprovision test.

Targets: blueprint murano-cfapi-func-tests

Change-Id: I6fc75f53b8f0c7b2a96ff2e1d5a63529efaf98df

Partial-Bug: #1484973'}]
commit_message:
Use appropriate types to store IP and MAC addrs

In PostgreSQL there are special types for storing IPv4, IPv6 address and
subnetworks and also MAC addresses. Storing data in these types is more
efficient than in strings because it requires less space. In addition,
it provides additional operations for columns of these types.

This patch changes types of some columns for models such as:

    IPAddr
        ip_addr: inet

    IPAddrRange
        first: inet
        last: inet

    Node
        mac: macaddr
        ip: inet

    NodeNICInterface
        mac: macaddr
        ip_addr: inet
        netmask: inet

    NodeNICInterface
        mac: macaddr

    NetworkGroup
        cidr: cidr
        gateway: inet

    NeutronConfig
        base_mac: macaddr
        internal_cidr: cidr
        internal_gateway: inet
        baremetal_gateway: inet

    NovaNetworkConfig
        fixed_networks_cidr: cidr

Co-Authored-By: Ilya Kharin <ikharin@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: Id8431eb7d2e3ca1a1cc29fc865d57359b29d0e35
Partial-Bug: #1484973

commit_message:
remove config files when run clean.sh

Currently we don't remove Ceilometer config files when ./clean.sh
is run, which should be fixed because it will bite developers when
they test change related to devstack script.

Note, this patch also removes ceilometer api log files when WSGI
is not enabled.

Change-Id: I3fd62787708cf64d1860b2b64d25773e79b17fe9
Closes-Bug: #1509253

commit_message:
Set DNS nameserver while configuring tenant network

Follow the install-guide more closely by setting the DNS nameserver
in config_tenant_network.

Use the same DNS nameserver (8.8.4.4) as the install-guide.

Don't set dnsmasq_dns_servers in setup_neutron_network anymore.

Change-Id: I626243f0e3f236f064e84921d3ffdcf0eba3aaeb

revisions:
[{'number': 21, 'created': '2015-11-23 13:35:43.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/openstack/manifests/keystone.pp', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/astute/tasks.yaml', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/globals/globals.pp', 'tests/noop/spec/hosts/keystone/keystone_spec.rb', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/keystone/keystone.pp', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/templates/globals_yaml.erb'], 'message': 'Enable Fernet token support

  - use fernet token by default
  - generate and install keys for fernet
  - add noop tests for new parameters

Co-Authored-By: Vasyl Saienko <vsaienko@mirantis.com>

Implements blueprint: fernet-tokens-support

Failed test:
master.fuel-library.pkgs.ubuntu.neutron_vlan_ha

This test contains this error: "Failed to execute hook 'copy_files' File does
not exist or is not readable /var/lib/fuel/keys/1/fernet-keys/1".
The cause of the issue is that only puppet manifest of Fuel Master node is
updated, but puppet manifests in docker container are not changed.

Change-Id: I98c677f1418e130c304c96eacc75e94f0180788a
'}]
commit_message:
Enable Fernet token support

  - use fernet token by default
  - generate and install keys for fernet
  - add noop tests for new parameters

Co-Authored-By: Vasyl Saienko <vsaienko@mirantis.com>

Implements blueprint: fernet-tokens-support

Failed test:
master.fuel-library.pkgs.ubuntu.neutron_vlan_ha

This test contains this error: "Failed to execute hook 'copy_files' File does
not exist or is not readable /var/lib/fuel/keys/1/fernet-keys/1".
The cause of the issue is that only puppet manifest of Fuel Master node is
updated, but puppet manifests in docker container are not changed.

Change-Id: I98c677f1418e130c304c96eacc75e94f0180788a

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1941, 'name': 'Lin Hua Cheng', 'email': 'os.lcheng@gmail.com', 'username': 'lin-hua-cheng'}, {'_account_id': 5046, 'name': 'Lance Bragstad', 'email': 'lbragstad@redhat.com', 'username': 'ldbragst'}, {'_account_id': 6482, 'name': 'Steve Martinelli', 'email': 's.martinelli@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevemar'}, {'_account_id': 6486, 'name': 'Brant Knudson', 'email': 'blk@acm.org', 'username': 'blk-u'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 10046, 'name': 'Henrique Truta', 'email': 'henrique@lsd.ufcg.edu.br', 'username': 'henriquetruta'}, {'_account_id': 11434, 'name': 'werner mendizabal', 'email': 'nonameentername@gmail.com', 'username': 'nonameentername'}, {'_account_id': 13063, 'name': 'WEI CHEN', 'email': 'dave.jungler@gmail.com', 'username': 'wei.d.chen'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-11-24 04:38:11.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/notifications.py', 'keystone/assignment/core.py'], 'message': "Correct docstring warnings

There were warnings printed when docs were generated:

 docstring of keystone.assignment.core.Manager.create_grant:8:
 ERROR: Unexpected indentation.

These are because the docstrings were not valid rst. The docstrings
are corrected.

In the case of create_grant, the problem is that the docstring of
the wrapper was used, so @functools.wraps is added so that the
docstring of the function is used rather than the wrapper. Also,
the wrapper's docstring was incorrectly formatted.

Also, corrected other issues with docstrings.

Change-Id: Ide6a85365f71330bf4caa24babc3bfe56174fc0f
"}]
commit_message:
Correct docstring warnings

There were warnings printed when docs were generated:

 docstring of keystone.assignment.core.Manager.create_grant:8:
 ERROR: Unexpected indentation.

These are because the docstrings were not valid rst. The docstrings
are corrected.

In the case of create_grant, the problem is that the docstring of
the wrapper was used, so @functools.wraps is added so that the
docstring of the function is used rather than the wrapper. Also,
the wrapper's docstring was incorrectly formatted.

Also, corrected other issues with docstrings.

Change-Id: Ide6a85365f71330bf4caa24babc3bfe56174fc0f

commit_message:
Remove vendor/downstream specific code

Also fix broken dependency of Package['pacemaker']
onto undef File, which was present in the code but
did nothing in fact (A-> undef -> B -> C == B -> C)

TODO figure out what to do with
./deployment/puppet/nailgun/files/Release-auxiliary

Change-Id: Ic8f495871ee4a1a9e7889c2b487cfd8d8b560139
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

subject: Don't trigger gate-fuel-web-python26 job for fuel-web
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-24 14:37:53.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Don't trigger gate-fuel-web-python26 job for fuel-web

gate-fuel-web-python26 job uses PostgreSQL version without
JSON DB type support, which is required for fuel-web. There's no
sense in keeping this job even in non-voting mode because it will
always fail.

Change-Id: Ide7b77777ca5334748f367c4c6bd244fd052c979
Closes-Bug: #1519371
"}]
commit_message:
Don't trigger gate-fuel-web-python26 job for fuel-web

gate-fuel-web-python26 job uses PostgreSQL version without
JSON DB type support, which is required for fuel-web. There's no
sense in keeping this job even in non-voting mode because it will
always fail.

Change-Id: Ide7b77777ca5334748f367c4c6bd244fd052c979
Closes-Bug: #1519371

commit_message:
Switch CinderEnableIscsiBackend to CinderEnableLvmBackend

As pointed out in [1] and [2], referring to the Cinder LVM backend
with the iSCSI name might be confusing. This change changes the
template parameter to use the name LVM instead.

1. https://review.gerrithub.io/#/c/233751/
2. https://review.gerrithub.io/#/c/234597/

Change-Id: I17a6236a435c764b3934db511dadd81cf1d26425

subject: Fix job deffinition for ceph job
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-24 11:36:51.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/devstack-gate.yaml'], 'message': "Fix job deffinition for ceph job

Recently, I4f70a3785ea4aeb38c3ebd8fd6a74ed3d035fa1a landed and fixed the
definition for the ceph-src job. This fix copies the same fix from that
job into the non-src ceph job as it's been failing in stable branches
with the same footprint.

The change removes the TEMPEST_FULL definition as the original fix did
and it changes the regular expression to align both jobs.

Change-Id: If289bfe3a5e4958411c8fae41a73971433c00d8b
"}]
commit_message:
Fix job deffinition for ceph job

Recently, I4f70a3785ea4aeb38c3ebd8fd6a74ed3d035fa1a landed and fixed the
definition for the ceph-src job. This fix copies the same fix from that
job into the non-src ceph job as it's been failing in stable branches
with the same footprint.

The change removes the TEMPEST_FULL definition as the original fix did
and it changes the regular expression to align both jobs.

Change-Id: If289bfe3a5e4958411c8fae41a73971433c00d8b

subject: midonet-db-manage: Retire migration functionalities
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-11-25 04:14:25.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/upgrade.rst', 'midonet/neutron/db/migration/cli.py'], 'message': 'midonet-db-manage: Retire migration functionalities

Remove sub-commands inherited from neutron-db-manage.
"neutron-db-manage --subproject networking-midonet" should be
used instead.

This commit doesn't remove the command itself as it has some
midonet specific sub-commands.  (task-list etc)

Closes-Bug: #1518180
Change-Id: I6ceb2f05190ee458943aa5c0748b02a0fca333be
'}]
commit_message:
midonet-db-manage: Retire migration functionalities

Remove sub-commands inherited from neutron-db-manage.
"neutron-db-manage --subproject networking-midonet" should be
used instead.

This commit doesn't remove the command itself as it has some
midonet specific sub-commands.  (task-list etc)

Closes-Bug: #1518180
Change-Id: I6ceb2f05190ee458943aa5c0748b02a0fca333be

commit_message:
Refactor IRMCVirtualMediaIscsiDeploy by applying new BootInterface

This patch refactors IRMCVirtualMediaIscsiDeploy by applying new
BootInterface. Consequently IRMCVirtualMediaIscsiDeploy is divided
into IRMCVirtualMediaBoot and IRMCVirtualMediaIscsiDeploy.

Implements: blueprint irmc-driver-uses-boot-interface

Change-Id: I709f3eb9b7798fa9b8a415bafbebbc24b03c5ebe

subject: Use wait_is_ready for finial choice
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-23 18:25:30.000000000', 'files': ['rally/task/utils.py'], 'message': 'Use wait_is_ready for finial choice

The old choice is wait_for_status, but using wait_is_ready could move
deletion logic and status check to new callbacks. And the callbacks'
arguments will not bother the wait_is_ready functions. The arguments for
wait_is_ready is only related wait logic, some example codes:

[task/utils.py]
def resource_deletion(resource):
    update = get_from_manager(resource)
    try:
        update(resource)
    except exceptions.GetResourceNotFound:
        return True
    return False

def resource_status(ready_status=[], failure_status=[]):
    """
    codes like wait_for_status, but it is a factury which produce
    callback here.
    """
    def callback(res):
        ...
    return callback

def wait_is_ready(resource, is_ready, timeout=60, interval=1):
    pass

[some scenario]
def xx_delete(self, xx):
    xx.delete()
    utils.wait_is_ready(xx, is_ready=utils.resource_deletion)

def xx_update(self, xx)
    xx.update(...)
    utils.wait_is_ready(xx, is_ready=utils.resource_status(
                ready_status=["READY"],
                failure_status=["FAIL"]))

So, the wait_is_ready is clean and xx_delete and xx_update is still
readable.

Change-Id: Ie8f92b5fa4a24455dae4ed06447c7f3fb68fd387
'}]
commit_message:
Use wait_is_ready for finial choice

The old choice is wait_for_status, but using wait_is_ready could move
deletion logic and status check to new callbacks. And the callbacks'
arguments will not bother the wait_is_ready functions. The arguments for
wait_is_ready is only related wait logic, some example codes:

[task/utils.py]
def resource_deletion(resource):
    update = get_from_manager(resource)
    try:
        update(resource)
    except exceptions.GetResourceNotFound:
        return True
    return False

def resource_status(ready_status=[], failure_status=[]):
    """
    codes like wait_for_status, but it is a factury which produce
    callback here.
    """
    def callback(res):
        ...
    return callback

def wait_is_ready(resource, is_ready, timeout=60, interval=1):
    pass

[some scenario]
def xx_delete(self, xx):
    xx.delete()
    utils.wait_is_ready(xx, is_ready=utils.resource_deletion)

def xx_update(self, xx)
    xx.update(...)
    utils.wait_is_ready(xx, is_ready=utils.resource_status(
                ready_status=["READY"],
                failure_status=["FAIL"]))

So, the wait_is_ready is clean and xx_delete and xx_update is still
readable.

Change-Id: Ie8f92b5fa4a24455dae4ed06447c7f3fb68fd387

commit_message:
Removing wait() when initializing notification listener

According to [1],the correct usage is to call stop() before wait(), so in
mistral case, we should never call stop() and wait() in initialization of
engine and executor service.

[1]:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.messaging/notification_listener.html

Change-Id: Ic6a802bff35a6a6fdfadf38474782efd12fd34d8
Closes-Bug: #1514459

subject: Fix state change on exception during task state change
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-10-30 18:26:20.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_direct_workflow.py', 'mistral/engine/default_engine.py'], 'message': 'Fix state change on exception during task state change

If there is an exception during on_task_state_change, particularly if
there is a YAQL evaluation error in the input of the next task, the state
of the current task and related action execution will be marked ERROR for
sync task and rolled back for async task, leaving the task as orphaned in
RUNNING state in most cases. This is a workflow handling error and the
workflow execution state is already marked ERROR. The state of the current
task execution should not be affected.

Change-Id: Id28b0661c09efa80a666d9eb7606fb435641a989
Closes-Bug: #1510738
'}]
commit_message:
Fix state change on exception during task state change

If there is an exception during on_task_state_change, particularly if
there is a YAQL evaluation error in the input of the next task, the state
of the current task and related action execution will be marked ERROR for
sync task and rolled back for async task, leaving the task as orphaned in
RUNNING state in most cases. This is a workflow handling error and the
workflow execution state is already marked ERROR. The state of the current
task execution should not be affected.

Change-Id: Id28b0661c09efa80a666d9eb7606fb435641a989
Closes-Bug: #1510738

commit_message:
Fixing SSH actions to use names of private keys

 * SSH action uses private key names instead of
   private keys themself. All private keys now
   should be in <user-home>/.ssh/, e.g. searching
   of key 'my_key.pem' will be at <user-home>/.ssh/my_key.pem
 * Fixed functional tests
 * Remove sudo while running tests

Closes-Bug: #1507600

Depends-On: Idc4340cda80d02f4ee88c91600b72d0f914c4084

Change-Id: I503d78ff541183ce850476229842fa6f20061a00

commit_message:
Add flavor argument to loadbalancer v2 create

Builds on cli changes for Neutron flavor framework, which have
now been merged.

The '--flavor' argument takes a flavor name or id, looking up the
id from name if needed.

The loadbalancer v2 service can be configured to use the flavor to
find the operator-selected provider and populate the provider field,
enabling dynamic operator control of which provider is being used on
creation.

Change-Id: I02ed05d56fab4d0f60a8616978970336b4415f2c
Implements: blueprint neutron-flavor-framework

subject: ICMP type & code validation while adding Security Group rules
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-11-25 06:15:24.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/locale/ja/LC_MESSAGES/django.po', 'horizon/test/tests/utils.py', 'openstack_dashboard/locale/de/LC_MESSAGES/django.po', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/access_and_security/security_groups/tests.py', 'openstack_dashboard/locale/cs/LC_MESSAGES/django.po', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/access_and_security/security_groups/forms.py', 'horizon/utils/validators.py'], 'message': "ICMP type & code validation while adding Security Group rules

While adding new 'Security Group Rule' viz. 'Custom ICMP rule' when
wrong ICMP 'type' or 'code' was given the errors it would show were
'Not a valid port number'; which is misleading. The errors should
rather be 'Not a valid ICMP type' or 'Not a valid ICMP code'.

Also for validating ICMP 'type' and 'code' there wasn't any dedicated
functionality in 'oslo.utils/netutils' so the code for validating 'TCP
ports' was used. TCP ports are in range 0 to 65535 while ICMP 'type'
and 'code' are in range 0 to 255, so using 'TCP port validation' code
is incorrect.

Here newer dedicated functionality of 'oslo.utils/netutils' is used
for validating ICMP 'type' and ICMP 'code'.

Change-Id: I3c9debc0eb156a4a3932b5e3f4dd601a313d065e
Closes-Bug: #1511748
"}]
commit_message:
ICMP type & code validation while adding Security Group rules

While adding new 'Security Group Rule' viz. 'Custom ICMP rule' when
wrong ICMP 'type' or 'code' was given the errors it would show were
'Not a valid port number'; which is misleading. The errors should
rather be 'Not a valid ICMP type' or 'Not a valid ICMP code'.

Also for validating ICMP 'type' and 'code' there wasn't any dedicated
functionality in 'oslo.utils/netutils' so the code for validating 'TCP
ports' was used. TCP ports are in range 0 to 65535 while ICMP 'type'
and 'code' are in range 0 to 255, so using 'TCP port validation' code
is incorrect.

Here newer dedicated functionality of 'oslo.utils/netutils' is used
for validating ICMP 'type' and ICMP 'code'.

Change-Id: I3c9debc0eb156a4a3932b5e3f4dd601a313d065e
Closes-Bug: #1511748

commit_message:
Include l2gw_plugin.ini while starting Neutron server

The patch set fixes the problem in the l2gw devstack scripts
where the l2gw_plugin.ini file neither gets copied to /etc/neutron,
nor is supplied while starting the neutron server.

Change-Id: If519e1a5394954d14673302aa8792f27017f60fa
Closes-Bug: 1511614

commit_message:
[Reports] Add an option for embedding JS/CSS libs into report

This change allows running command `report' with `--html-static'
option so all required JS/CSS will be embedded to HTML file.
Having all required CSS/JS loaded directly from HTML makes
report working without access to the Internet.

Added third-party libraries files:
    rally/ui/templates/libs/nv.d3.1.1.15-beta.min.css
    rally/ui/templates/libs/angular.1.3.3.min.js
    rally/ui/templates/libs/nv.d3.1.1.15-beta.min.js
    rally/ui/templates/libs/d3.3.4.13.min.js

Notes about licenses compatibility:
    https://angularjs.org/
    https://github.com/angular/angular.js/blob/master/LICENSE
    The MIT License
    compatible with Apache License Version 2.0
    according to http://www.apache.org/legal/resolved.html

    http://d3js.org/
    https://github.com/mbostock/d3/blob/master/LICENSE

    compatible with Apache License Version 2.0
    according to http://www.apache.org/legal/resolved.html

    http://nvd3.org/
    https://github.com/novus/nvd3/blob/master/LICENSE.md
    Apache License Version 2.0

Change-Id: I8913ecc585ee17affb1d8a0b29bb475c1e07427f
Closes-Bug: #1505533

subject: Fix flavor quota charts in NG Launch Instance
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-24 16:36:47.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/static/framework/widgets/charts/pie-chart.spec.js', 'horizon/static/framework/widgets/charts/pie-chart.html'], 'message': "Fix flavor quota charts in NG Launch Instance

The flavor quota charts aren't rendering correctly
when the instance count is changed in the Angular
Launch Instance modal. The <svg> element was not
available to add slices as 'chartData.showChart'
is originally undefined.

This patches fixes the the issue by using ng-show
instead of ng-if.

Change-Id: I7b24da7942c3d02a55adc732d70a26aeb5b623ec
Closes-Bug: #1518030
"}]
commit_message:
Fix flavor quota charts in NG Launch Instance

The flavor quota charts aren't rendering correctly
when the instance count is changed in the Angular
Launch Instance modal. The <svg> element was not
available to add slices as 'chartData.showChart'
is originally undefined.

This patches fixes the the issue by using ng-show
instead of ng-if.

Change-Id: I7b24da7942c3d02a55adc732d70a26aeb5b623ec
Closes-Bug: #1518030

commit_message:
[install] text clean up and clarifications in neutron-concepts

Removed redundant text about routers which is repeated later on. Also
removed text about DHCP being disabled on external networks as I believe
this is incorrect. Clarification on "network" that it's external networks
where gateways are.  A couple of cosmetic minor changes as well.

Closes-Bug: #1519457
Change-Id: I350616c1d187b8999d7ff33c322461d91ef14691

subject: libvirt: optimize multipath call to identify IQN
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 6849, 'name': 'Roman Podoliaka', 'email': 'roman.podoliaka@gmail.com', 'username': 'rpodolyaka'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9569, 'name': 'Sergey Nikitin', 'email': 'nikitinserv@gmail.com', 'username': 'snikitin'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10068, 'name': 'Welcome, new contributor!', 'username': 'welcome-message'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10618, 'name': 'Pavel Kholkin', 'email': 'p.v.holkin@mail.ru', 'username': 'pkholkin'}, {'_account_id': 11103, 'name': 'Intel PCI CI', 'email': 'otc_cloud@163.com', 'username': 'intelotccloud', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 13847, 'name': 'Keiichi KII', 'email': 'k-keiichi@bx.jp.nec.com', 'username': 'kii'}, {'_account_id': 15122, 'name': 'Kiseok Kim', 'email': 'kiseok7@gmail.com', 'username': 'Kiseok'}, {'_account_id': 15286, 'name': 'XenProject CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@xenproject.org', 'username': 'XenProject-CI', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-07-14 06:35:06.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/volume.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_volume.py'], 'message': "libvirt: optimize multipath call to identify IQN

When detaching a multipath volume in an environment where there are
many attached volumes, excessive multipath calls are generated and
it takes too much time. This issue is due to the fact that a multipath -ll
call against many multipath devices takes a few seconds.

When detaching a volume, the current _disconnect_volume_multipath_iscsi()
calls 'multipath -ll <each iscsi device>' against every iscsi devices.
This behavior is to identify the IQNs used by multipath device, however
the IQNs are extracted from one 'multipath -ll' call without massive
'multipath -ll <each iscsi device>' calls.

This patch changes the behavior of identifying IQNs used by multipath device:

  1. add an utility to identify IQNs by using multipath device map
     (/dev/sdX => /dev/mapper/XXX) generated by parsing 'multipath -ll'.
  2. replace the current nested for loop to identify the IQNs with
     the utility.

Co-Authored-By: Pavel Kholkin <pkholkin@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I77e6eda950726d7ee9a0d92882d4501e70a0d8f8
Closes-Bug: #1277316
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: optimize multipath call to identify IQN

When detaching a multipath volume in an environment where there are
many attached volumes, excessive multipath calls are generated and
it takes too much time. This issue is due to the fact that a multipath -ll
call against many multipath devices takes a few seconds.

When detaching a volume, the current _disconnect_volume_multipath_iscsi()
calls 'multipath -ll <each iscsi device>' against every iscsi devices.
This behavior is to identify the IQNs used by multipath device, however
the IQNs are extracted from one 'multipath -ll' call without massive
'multipath -ll <each iscsi device>' calls.

This patch changes the behavior of identifying IQNs used by multipath device:

  1. add an utility to identify IQNs by using multipath device map
     (/dev/sdX => /dev/mapper/XXX) generated by parsing 'multipath -ll'.
  2. replace the current nested for loop to identify the IQNs with
     the utility.

Co-Authored-By: Pavel Kholkin <pkholkin@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I77e6eda950726d7ee9a0d92882d4501e70a0d8f8
Closes-Bug: #1277316

Mount the device to it.
